198{
199 type = &id.obj();
200 moves = type->speed;
201 Creature::set_speed_base( type->speed );
202 hp = type->hp;
203 for( auto &sa : type->special_attacks ) {

205 entry.cooldown = rng( 0, sa.second->cooldown );

208 morale = type->morale;

210 ammo = type->starting_ammo;

212 reproduces = type->reproduces && type->baby_timer && !monster::has_flag( MF_NO_BREED );

◆ attack_at()

bool monster::attack_at ( const tripoint &  p)

Attack any enemies at the given location.

Attacks only if there is a creature at the given location towards we are hostile.

Returns
true if something was attacked, false otherwise

Definition at line 1428 of file monmove.cpp.

1429{
1430 if( has_flag( MF_PACIFIST ) ) {
1431 return false;
1432 }
1433 if( p.z != posz() ) {
1434 // TODO: Remove this
1435 return false;
1436 }
1437
1438 if( p == g->u.pos() ) {
1439 melee_attack( g->u );
1440 return true;
1441 }
1442
1443 if( const auto mon_ = g->critter_at<monster>( p, is_hallucination() ) ) {
1444 monster &mon = *mon_;
1445
1446 // Don't attack yourself.
1447 if( &mon == this ) {
1448 return false;
1449 }
1450
1451 // With no melee dice, we can't attack, but we had to process until here
1452 // because hallucinations require no melee dice to destroy.
1453 if( type->melee_dice <= 0 ) {
1454 return false;
1455 }
1456
1457 auto attitude = attitude_to( mon );
1458 // MF_ATTACKMON == hulk behavior, whack everything in your way
1459 if( attitude == A_HOSTILE || has_flag( MF_ATTACKMON ) ) {
1460 melee_attack( mon );
1461 return true;
1462 }
1463
1464 return false;
1465 }
1466
1467 npc *const guy = g->critter_at<npc>( p );
1468 if( guy && type->melee_dice > 0 ) {
1469 // For now we're always attacking NPCs that are getting into our
1470 // way. This is consistent with how it worked previously, but
1471 // later on not hitting allied NPCs would be cool.
1472 guy->on_attacked( *this ); // allow NPC hallucination to be one shot by monsters
1473 melee_attack( *guy );
1474 return true;
1475 }
1476
1477 // Nothing to attack.
1478 return false;
1479}

◆ attitude()

monster_attitude monster::attitude ( const Character *  u = nullptr) const

Definition at line 1066 of file monster.cpp.

1067{
1068 if( friendly != 0 ) {
1069 if( has_effect( effect_docile ) ) {
1070 return MATT_FPASSIVE;
1071 }
1072 if( u == &g->u ) {
1073 return MATT_FRIEND;
1074 }
1075 // Zombies don't understand not attacking NPCs, but dogs and bots should.
1076 const npc *np = dynamic_cast< const npc * >( u );
1077 if( np != nullptr && np->get_attitude() != NPCATT_KILL && !type->in_species( ZOMBIE ) ) {
1078 return MATT_FRIEND;
1079 }
1080 if( np != nullptr && np->is_hallucination() ) {
1081 return MATT_IGNORE;
1082 }
1083 }
1084 if( effect_cache[FLEEING] ) {
1085 return MATT_FLEE;
1086 }
1087 if( has_effect( effect_pacified ) ) {
1088 return MATT_ZLAVE;
1089 }
1090
1091 int effective_anger = anger;
1092 int effective_morale = morale;
1093
1094 if( u != nullptr ) {
1095 // Those are checked quite often, so avoiding string construction is a good idea
1096 static const string_id<monfaction> faction_bee( "bee" );
1097 if( faction == faction_bee ) {
1098 if( u->has_trait( trait_BEE ) ) {
1099 return MATT_FRIEND;
1100 } else if( u->has_trait( trait_FLOWERS ) ) {
1101 effective_anger -= 10;
1102 }
1103 }
1104
1105 if( type->in_species( FUNGUS ) && ( u->has_trait( trait_THRESH_MYCUS ) ||
1106 u->has_trait( trait_MYCUS_FRIEND ) ) ) {
1107 return MATT_FRIEND;
1108 }
1109
1110 if( effective_anger >= 10 &&
1111 ( ( type->in_species( MAMMAL ) && u->has_trait( trait_PHEROMONE_MAMMAL ) ) ||
1112 ( type->in_species( INSECT ) && u->has_trait( trait_PHEROMONE_INSECT ) ) ) ) {
1113 effective_anger -= 20;
1114 }
1115
1116 if( u->has_trait( trait_TERRIFYING ) ) {
1117 effective_morale -= 10;
1118 }
1119
1120 if( has_flag( MF_ANIMAL ) ) {
1121 if( u->has_trait( trait_ANIMALEMPATH ) ) {
1122 effective_anger -= 10;
1123 if( effective_anger < 10 ) {
1124 effective_morale += 55;
1125 }
1126 } else if( u->has_trait( trait_ANIMALEMPATH2 ) ) {
1127 effective_anger -= 20;
1128 if( effective_anger < 20 ) {
1129 effective_morale += 80;
1130 }
1131 } else if( u->has_trait( trait_ANIMALDISCORD ) ) {
1132 if( effective_anger >= 10 ) {
1133 effective_anger += 10;
1134 }
1135 if( effective_anger < 10 ) {
1136 effective_morale -= 5;
1137 }
1138 } else if( u->has_trait( trait_ANIMALDISCORD2 ) ) {
1139 if( effective_anger >= 20 ) {
1140 effective_anger += 20;
1141 }
1142 if( effective_anger < 20 ) {
1143 effective_morale -= 5;
1144 }
1145 }
1146 }
1147
1148 for( const trait_id &mut : u->get_mutations() ) {
1149 for( const std::pair<const species_id, int> &elem : mut.obj().anger_relations ) {
1150 if( type->in_species( elem.first ) ) {
1151 effective_anger += elem.second;
1152 }
1153 }
1154 }
1155
1156 for( const trait_id &mut : u->get_mutations() ) {
1157 for( const species_id &spe : mut.obj().ignored_by ) {
1158 if( type->in_species( spe ) ) {
1159 return MATT_IGNORE;
1160 }
1161 }
1162 }
1163 }
1164
1165 if( effective_morale < 0 ) {
1166 if( effective_morale + effective_anger > 0 && get_hp() > get_hp_max() / 3 ) {
1167 return MATT_FOLLOW;
1168 }
1169 return MATT_FLEE;
1170 }
1171
1172 if( effective_anger <= 0 ) {
1173 if( get_hp() != get_hp_max() ) {
1174 return MATT_FLEE;
1175 } else {
1176 return MATT_IGNORE;
1177 }
1178 }
1179
1180 if( effective_anger < 10 ) {
1181 return MATT_FOLLOW;
1182 }
1183
1184 return MATT_ATTACK;
1185}

◆ attitude_to()

Creature::Attitude monster::attitude_to ( const Creature &  other) const
overridevirtual

Attitude (of this creature) towards another creature.

This might not be symmetric.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 1020 of file monster.cpp.

1021{
1022 const monster *m = other.is_monster() ? static_cast< const monster *>( &other ) : nullptr;
1023 const player *p = other.as_player();
1024 if( m != nullptr ) {
1025 if( m == this ) {
1026 return A_FRIENDLY;
1027 }
1028
1029 auto faction_att = faction.obj().attitude( m->faction );
1030 if( ( friendly != 0 && m->friendly != 0 ) ||
1031 ( friendly == 0 && m->friendly == 0 && faction_att == MFA_FRIENDLY ) ) {
1032 // Friendly (to player) monsters are friendly to each other
1033 // Unfriendly monsters go by faction attitude
1034 return A_FRIENDLY;
1035 } else if( ( friendly == 0 && m->friendly == 0 && faction_att == MFA_HATE ) ) {
1036 // Stuff that hates a specific faction will always attack that faction
1037 return A_HOSTILE;
1038 } else if( ( friendly == 0 && m->friendly == 0 && faction_att == MFA_NEUTRAL ) ||
1039 morale < 0 || anger < 10 ) {
1040 // Stuff that won't attack is neutral to everything
1041 return A_NEUTRAL;
1042 } else {
1043 return A_HOSTILE;
1044 }
1045 } else if( p != nullptr ) {
1046 switch( attitude( const_cast<player *>( p ) ) ) {
1047 case MATT_FRIEND:
1048 case MATT_ZLAVE:
1049 return A_FRIENDLY;
1050 case MATT_FPASSIVE:
1051 case MATT_FLEE:
1052 case MATT_IGNORE:
1053 case MATT_FOLLOW:
1054 return A_NEUTRAL;
1055 case MATT_ATTACK:
1056 return A_HOSTILE;
1057 case MATT_NULL:
1058 case NUM_MONSTER_ATTITUDES:
1059 break;
1060 }
1061 }
1062 // Should not happen!, creature should be either player or monster
1063 return A_NEUTRAL;
1064}

◆ avoid_trap()

bool monster::avoid_trap ( const tripoint &  pos,
const trap &  tr 
) const
overridevirtual

Called when a creature triggers a trap, returns true if they don't set it off.

Parameters
tris the trap that was triggered.
posis the location of the trap (not necessarily of the creature) in the main map.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 858 of file monster.cpp.

859{
860 // The trap position is not used, monsters are to stupid to remember traps. Actually, they do
861 // not even see them.
862 // Traps are on the ground, digging monsters go below, fliers and climbers go above.
863 if( digging() || flies() ) {
864 return true;
865 }
866 return dice( 3, type->sk_dodge + 1 ) >= dice( 3, tr.get_avoidance() );
867}

◆ bash_at()

bool monster::bash_at ( const tripoint &  p)

Try to smash/bash/destroy your way through the terrain at p.

Returns
true if we destroyed something, false otherwise.

Definition at line 1327 of file monmove.cpp.

1328{
1329 if( p.z != posz() ) {
1330 // TODO: Remove this
1331 return false;
1332 }
1333
1334 //Hallucinations can't bash stuff.
1335 if( is_hallucination() ) {
1336 return false;
1337 }
1338
1339 // Don't bash if a friendly monster is standing there
1340 monster *target = g->critter_at<monster>( p );
1341 if( target != nullptr && attitude_to( *target ) == A_FRIENDLY ) {
1342 return false;
1343 }
1344
1345 bool try_bash = !can_move_to( p ) || one_in( 3 );
1346 if( !try_bash ) {
1347 return false;
1348 }
1349
1350 bool can_bash = g->m.is_bashable( p ) && bash_skill() > 0;
1351 if( !can_bash ) {
1352 return false;
1353 }
1354
1355 bool flat_ground = g->m.has_flag( "ROAD", p ) || g->m.has_flag( "FLAT", p );
1356 if( flat_ground ) {
1357 bool can_bash_ter = g->m.is_bashable_ter( p );
1358 bool try_bash_ter = one_in( 50 );
1359 if( !( can_bash_ter && try_bash_ter ) ) {
1360 return false;
1361 }
1362 }
1363
1364 int bashskill = group_bash_skill( p );
1365 g->m.bash( p, bashskill );
1366 moves -= 100;
1367 return true;
1368}

◆ calc_movecost()

int monster::calc_movecost ( const tripoint &  f,
const tripoint &  t 
) const

Definition at line 1228 of file monmove.cpp.

1229{
1230 int movecost = 0;
1231
1232 const int source_cost = g->m.move_cost( f );
1233 const int dest_cost = g->m.move_cost( t );
1234 // Digging and flying monsters ignore terrain cost
1235 if( flies() || ( digging() && g->m.has_flag( "DIGGABLE", t ) ) ) {
1236 movecost = 100;
1237 // Swimming monsters move super fast in water
1238 } else if( swims() ) {
1239 if( g->m.has_flag( "SWIMMABLE", f ) ) {
1240 movecost += 25;
1241 } else {
1242 movecost += 50 * g->m.move_cost( f );
1243 }
1244 if( g->m.has_flag( "SWIMMABLE", t ) ) {
1245 movecost += 25;
1246 } else {
1247 movecost += 50 * g->m.move_cost( t );
1248 }
1249 } else if( can_submerge() ) {
1250 // No-breathe monsters have to walk underwater slowly
1251 if( g->m.has_flag( "SWIMMABLE", f ) ) {
1252 movecost += 250;
1253 } else {
1254 movecost += 50 * g->m.move_cost( f );
1255 }
1256 if( g->m.has_flag( "SWIMMABLE", t ) ) {
1257 movecost += 250;
1258 } else {
1259 movecost += 50 * g->m.move_cost( t );
1260 }
1261 movecost /= 2;
1262 } else if( climbs() ) {
1263 if( g->m.has_flag( "CLIMBABLE", f ) ) {
1264 movecost += 150;
1265 } else {
1266 movecost += 50 * g->m.move_cost( f );
1267 }
1268 if( g->m.has_flag( "CLIMBABLE", t ) ) {
1269 movecost += 150;
1270 } else {
1271 movecost += 50 * g->m.move_cost( t );
1272 }
1273 movecost /= 2;
1274 } else {
1275 movecost = ( ( 50 * source_cost ) + ( 50 * dest_cost ) ) / 2.0;
1276 }
1277
1278 return movecost;
1279}
monster::swims
bool swims() const
Definition: monster.cpp:926
monster::can_submerge
bool can_submerge() const
Definition: monster.cpp:884

References can_submerge(), climbs(), digging(), flies(), g, and swims().

◆ can_move_to()

bool monster::can_move_to ( const tripoint &  p) const

Checks whether we can move to/through p.

This does not account for bashing.

This is used in pathfinding and ONLY checks the terrain. It ignores players and monsters, which might only block this tile temporarily. will_move_to() checks for impassable terrain etc can_reach_to() checks for z-level difference. can_move_to() is a wrapper for both of them.

Definition at line 249 of file monmove.cpp.

250{
251 return can_reach_to( p ) && will_move_to( p );
252}
monster::can_reach_to
bool can_reach_to(const tripoint &p) const
Definition: monmove.cpp:228
monster::will_move_to
bool will_move_to(const tripoint &p) const
Definition: monmove.cpp:117

References can_reach_to(), and will_move_to().

Referenced by bash_at(), mattack::grab_drag(), move(), move_to(), push_to(), scent_move(), map::spawn_monsters_submap(), stumble(), and game::update_stair_monsters().

◆ can_reach_to()

bool monster::can_reach_to ( const tripoint &  p) const

Definition at line 228 of file monmove.cpp.

229{
230 map &here = get_map();
231 if( p.z > pos().z && z_is_valid( pos().z ) ) {
232 if( here.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_UP, tripoint( p.xy(), p.z - 1 ) ) ) {
233 return true;
234 }
235 if( !here.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_UP, pos() ) && !here.has_flag( TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, p ) ) {
236 // can't go through the roof
237 return false;
238 }
239 } else if( p.z < pos().z && z_is_valid( pos().z ) ) {
240 if( !here.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, pos() ) ) {
241 // can't go through the floor
242 // you would fall anyway if there was no floor, so no need to check for that here
243 return false;
244 }
245 }
246 return true;
247}

Definition at line 1572 of file monster.cpp.

1574{
1575 switch( du.type ) {
1576 case DT_ELECTRIC:
1577 if( has_flag( MF_ELECTRIC ) ) {
1578 return; // immunity
1579 }
1580 break;
1581 case DT_COLD:
1582 if( has_flag( MF_COLDPROOF ) ) {
1583 return; // immunity
1584 }
1585 break;
1586 case DT_BASH:
1587 if( has_flag( MF_PLASTIC ) ) {
1588 damage += du.amount / rng( 2, 4 ); // lessened effect
1589 pain += du.amount / 4;
1590 return;
1591 }
1592 break;
1593 case DT_NULL:
1594 debugmsg( "monster::deal_damage_handle_type: illegal damage type DT_NULL" );
1595 break;
1596 case DT_ACID:
1597 if( has_flag( MF_ACIDPROOF ) ) {
1598 // immunity
1599 return;
1600 }
1601 case DT_TRUE:
1602 // typeless damage, should always go through
1603 case DT_BIOLOGICAL:
1604 // internal damage, like from smoke or poison
1605 case DT_CUT:
1606 case DT_STAB:
1607 case DT_BULLET:
1608 case DT_HEAT:
1609 default:
1610 break;
1611 }
1612

◆ drop_items_on_death()

void monster::drop_items_on_death ( )

Definition at line 2424 of file monster.cpp.

2425{
2426 if( is_hallucination() ) {
2427 return;
2428 }
2429 if( !type->death_drops ) {
2430 return;
2431 }
2432
2433 std::vector<item> items = item_group::items_from( type->death_drops, calendar::start_of_cataclysm );
2434
2435 // This block removes some items, according to item spawn scaling factor
2436 const float spawn_rate = get_option<float>( "ITEM_SPAWNRATE" );
2437 if( spawn_rate < 1 ) {
2438 // Temporary vector, to remember which items will be dropped
2439 std::vector<item> remaining;
2440 for( const item &it : items ) {
2441 if( rng_float( 0, 1 ) < spawn_rate ) {
2442 remaining.push_back( it );
2443 }
2444 }
2445 // If there aren't any items left, there's nothing left to do
2446 if( remaining.empty() ) {
2447 return;
2448 }
2449 items = remaining;
2450 }
2451
2452 const auto dropped = g->m.spawn_items( pos(), items );
2453
2454 if( has_flag( MF_FILTHY ) && get_option<bool>( "FILTHY_CLOTHES" ) ) {
2455 for( const auto &it : dropped ) {
2456 if( ( it->is_armor() || it->is_pet_armor() ) && !it->is_gun() ) {
2457 // handle wearable guns as a special case
2458 it->set_flag( "FILTHY" );
2459 }
2460 }
2461 }
2462}

◆ find_dragged_foe()

player * monster::find_dragged_foe ( )
private

Definition at line 1034 of file monmove.cpp.

1035{
1036 // Make sure they're actually dragging someone.
1037 if( !dragged_foe_id.is_valid() || !has_effect( effect_dragging ) ) {
1038 dragged_foe_id = character_id();
1039 return nullptr;
1040 }
1041
1042 // Dragged critters may die or otherwise become invalid, which is why we look
1043 // them up each time. Luckily, monsters dragging critters is relatively rare,
1044 // so this check should happen infrequently.
1045 player *dragged_foe = g->critter_by_id<player>( dragged_foe_id );
1046
1047 if( dragged_foe == nullptr ) {
1048 // Target no longer valid.
1049 dragged_foe_id = character_id();
1050 remove_effect( effect_dragging );
1051 }
1052
1053 return dragged_foe;
1054}

1114 if( made_footstep ) {
1115 return;

1118 int volume = 6; // same as player's footsteps
1119 if( flies() ) {
1120 volume = 0; // Flying monsters don't have footsteps!
1121 }
1122 if( digging() ) {
1123 volume = 10;
1124 }
1125 switch( type->size ) {
1126 case MS_TINY:
1127 volume = 0; // No sound for the tinies
1128 break;
1129 case MS_SMALL:
1130 volume /= 3;
1131 break;
1132 case MS_MEDIUM:
1133 break;
1134 case MS_LARGE:

1136 break;

1139 break;

1145 }

2729 }

2732 }

◆ group_bash_skill()

int monster::group_bash_skill ( const tripoint &  target)

Returns ability of monster and any cooperative helpers to bash the designated target.


Definition at line 1386 of file monmove.cpp.

1387{
1388 if( !has_flag( MF_GROUP_BASH ) ) {
1389 return bash_skill();
1390 }
1391 int bashskill = 0;
1392
1393 // pileup = more bash skill, but only help bashing mob directly in front of target
1394 const int max_helper_depth = 5;
1395 const std::vector<tripoint> bzone = get_bashing_zone( target, pos(), max_helper_depth );
1396
1397 for( const tripoint &candidate : bzone ) {
1398 // Drawing this line backwards excludes the target and includes the candidate.
1399 std::vector<tripoint> path_to_target = line_to( target, candidate, 0, 0 );
1400 bool connected = true;
1401 monster *mon = nullptr;
1402 for( const tripoint &in_path : path_to_target ) {
1403 // If any point in the line from zombie to target is not a cooperating zombie,
1404 // it can't contribute.
1405 mon = g->critter_at<monster>( in_path );
1406 if( !mon ) {
1407 connected = false;
1408 break;
1409 }
1410 monster &helpermon = *mon;
1411 if( !helpermon.has_flag( MF_GROUP_BASH ) || helpermon.is_hallucination() ) {
1412 connected = false;
1413 break;
1414 }
1415 }
1416 if( !connected || !mon ) {
1417 continue;
1418 }
1419 // If we made it here, the last monster checked was the candidate.
1420 monster &helpermon = *mon;
1421 // Contribution falls off rapidly with distance from target.
1422 bashskill += helpermon.bash_skill() / rl_dist( candidate, target );
1423 }
1424
1425 return bashskill;
1426}
line_to
std::vector< coords::coord_point< Point, Origin, Scale > > line_to(const coords::coord_point< Point, Origin, Scale > &loc1, const coords::coord_point< Point, Origin, Scale > &loc2)
Definition: coordinates.h:548
get_bashing_zone
static std::vector< tripoint > get_bashing_zone(const tripoint &bashee, const tripoint &basher, int maxdepth)
Definition: monmove.cpp:1301

References bash_skill(), g, get_bashing_zone(), has_flag(), is_hallucination(), line_to(), MF_GROUP_BASH, pos(), and rl_dist().

Referenced by bash_at().

Flat addition to the monsters hp.

If overheal is true, this is not capped by max hp. Returns actually healed hp.

◆ hear_sound()

void monster::hear_sound ( const tripoint &  source,
int  vol,
int  distance 
)

Makes monster react to heard sound.

Parameters
sourceLocation of the sound source
volVolume at the center of the sound source
distanceDistance to sound source (currently just rl_dist)

Definition at line 2909 of file monster.cpp.

2910{
2911 if( !can_hear() ) {
2912 return;
2913 }
2914
2915 const bool goodhearing = has_flag( MF_GOODHEARING );
2916 const int volume = goodhearing ? 2 * vol - dist : vol - dist;
2917 // Error is based on volume, louder sound = less error
2918 if( volume <= 0 ) {
2919 return;
2920 }
2921
2922 int max_error = 0;
2923 if( volume < 2 ) {
2924 max_error = 10;
2925 } else if( volume < 5 ) {
2926 max_error = 5;
2927 } else if( volume < 10 ) {
2928 max_error = 3;
2929 } else if( volume < 20 ) {
2930 max_error = 1;
2931 }
2932
2933 int target_x = source.x + rng( -max_error, max_error );
2934 int target_y = source.y + rng( -max_error, max_error );
2935 // target_z will require some special check due to soil muffling sounds
2936
2937 int wander_turns = volume * ( goodhearing ? 6 : 1 );
2938 process_trigger( mon_trigger::SOUND, volume );
2939 if( morale >= 0 && anger >= 10 ) {
2940 // TODO: Add a proper check for fleeing attitude
2941 // but cache it nicely, because this part is called a lot
2942 wander_to( tripoint( target_x, target_y, source.z ), wander_turns );
2943 } else if( morale < 0 ) {
2944 // Monsters afraid of sound should not go towards sound
2945 wander_to( tripoint( 2 * posx() - target_x, 2 * posy() - target_y, 2 * posz() - source.z ),
2946 wander_turns );
2947 }
2948}

bool can_hear() const

◆ init_from_item()

void monster::init_from_item ( const item &  itm)

Initialize values like speed / hp from data of an item.

This applies to robotic monsters that are spawned by invoking an item (e.g. turret), and to reviving monsters that spawn from a corpse.

Definition at line 2758 of file monster.cpp.

2759{
2760 if( itm.typeId() == itype_corpse ) {
2761 set_speed_base( get_speed_base() * 0.8 );
2762 const int burnt_penalty = itm.burnt;
2763 hp = static_cast<int>( hp * 0.7 );
2764 if( itm.damage_level( 4 ) > 0 ) {
2765 set_speed_base( speed_base / ( itm.damage_level( 4 ) + 1 ) );
2766 hp /= itm.damage_level( 4 ) + 1;
2767 }
2768
2769 hp -= burnt_penalty;
2770
2771 // HP can be 0 or less, in this case revive_corpse will just deactivate the corpse
2772 if( hp > 0 && type->has_flag( MF_REVIVES_HEALTHY ) ) {
2773 hp = type->hp;
2774 set_speed_base( type->speed );
2775 }
2776 const std::string up_time = itm.get_var( "upgrade_time" );
2777 if( !up_time.empty() ) {
2778 upgrade_time = std::stoi( up_time );
2779 }
2780 } else {
2781 // must be a robot
2782 const int damfac = itm.max_damage() - std::max( 0, itm.damage() ) + 1;
2783 // One hp at least, everything else would be unfair (happens only to monster with *very* low hp),
2784 hp = std::max( 1, hp * damfac / ( itm.max_damage() + 1 ) );
2785 }
2786}

◆ is_immune_field()

bool monster::is_immune_field ( const field_type_id &  ) const
overridevirtual

Returns true if we are immune to the field type with the given fid.

Does not handle intensity, so this function should only be called through is_dangerous_field().

Reimplemented from Creature.

Definition at line 81 of file monmove.cpp.

82{
83 if( fid == fd_fungal_haze ) {
84 return has_flag( MF_NO_BREATHE ) || type->in_species( FUNGUS );
85 }
86 if( fid == fd_fungicidal_gas ) {
87 return !type->in_species( FUNGUS );
88 }
89 if( fid == fd_insecticidal_gas ) {
90 return !type->in_species( INSECT ) && !type->in_species( SPIDER );
91 }
92 const field_type &ft = fid.obj();
93 if( ft.has_fume ) {
94 return has_flag( MF_NO_BREATHE );
95 }
96 if( ft.has_acid ) {
97 return has_flag( MF_ACIDPROOF ) || flies();
98 }
99 if( ft.has_fire ) {
100 return has_flag( MF_FIREPROOF );
101 }
102 if( ft.has_elec ) {
103 return has_flag( MF_ELECTRIC );
104 }
105 if( ft.immune_mtypes.count( type->id ) > 0 ) {
106 return true;
107 }
108 // No specific immunity was found, so fall upwards
109 return Creature::is_immune_field( fid );
110}

◆ knock_back_to()

void monster::knock_back_to ( const tripoint &  to)
overridevirtual

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 1881 of file monmove.cpp.

1882{
1883 if( to == pos() ) {
1884 return; // No effect
1885 }
1886
1887 if( is_hallucination() ) {
1888 die( nullptr );
1889 return;
1890 }
1891
1892 bool u_see = g->u.sees( to );
1893
1894 // First, see if we hit another monster
1895 if( monster *const z = g->critter_at<monster>( to ) ) {
1896 apply_damage( z, bodypart_id( "torso" ), z->type->size );
1897 add_effect( effect_stunned, 1_turns );
1898 if( type->size > 1 + z->type->size ) {
1899 z->knock_back_from( pos() ); // Chain reaction!
1900 z->apply_damage( this, bodypart_id( "torso" ), type->size );
1901 z->add_effect( effect_stunned, 1_turns );
1902 } else if( type->size > z->type->size ) {
1903 z->apply_damage( this, bodypart_id( "torso" ), type->size );
1904 z->add_effect( effect_stunned, 1_turns );
1905 }
1906 z->check_dead_state();
1907
1908 if( u_see ) {
1909 add_msg( _( "The %1$s bounces off a %2$s!" ), name(), z->name() );
1910 }
1911
1912 return;
1913 }
1914
1915 if( npc *const p = g->critter_at<npc>( to ) ) {
1916 apply_damage( p, bodypart_id( "torso" ), 3 );
1917 add_effect( effect_stunned, 1_turns );
1918 p->deal_damage( this, bodypart_id( "torso" ), damage_instance( DT_BASH, type->size ) );
1919 if( u_see ) {
1920 add_msg( _( "The %1$s bounces off %2$s!" ), name(), p->name );
1921 }
1922
1923 p->check_dead_state();
1924 return;
1925 }
1926
1927 // If we're still in the function at this point, we're actually moving a tile!
1928 // die_if_drowning will kill the monster if necessary, but if the deep water
1929 // tile is on a vehicle, we should check for swimmers out of water
1930 if( !die_if_drowning( to ) && has_flag( MF_AQUATIC ) ) {
1931 die( nullptr );
1932 if( u_see ) {
1933 add_msg( _( "The %s flops around and dies!" ), name() );
1934 }
1935 }
1936
1937 if( g->m.impassable( to ) ) {
1938
1939 // It's some kind of wall.
1940 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), type->size );
1941 add_effect( effect_stunned, 2_turns );
1942 if( u_see ) {
1943 add_msg( _( "The %1$s bounces off a %2$s." ), name(),
1944 g->m.obstacle_name( to ) );
1945 }
1946
1947 } else { // It's no wall
1948 setpos( to );
1949 }
1950 check_dead_state();
1951}

1770{
1771 Creature::load( data );
1772
1773 std::string sidtmp;
1774 // load->str->int
1775 data.read( "typeid", sidtmp );
1776 type = &mtype_id( sidtmp ).obj();
1777
1778 data.read( "unique_name", unique_name );
1779 data.read( "posx", position.x );
1780 data.read( "posy", position.y );
1781 if( !data.read( "posz", position.z ) ) {
1782 position.z = g->get_levz();
1783 }
1784
1785 data.read( "wandf", wandf );
1786 data.read( "wandx", wander_pos.x );
1787 data.read( "wandy", wander_pos.y );
1788 if( data.read( "wandz", wander_pos.z ) ) {
1789 wander_pos.z = position.z;
1790 }
1791 if( data.has_object( "tied_item" ) ) {
1792 JsonIn *tied_item_json = data.get_raw( "tied_item" );
1793 item newitem;
1794 newitem.deserialize( *tied_item_json );
1795 tied_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
1796 }
1797 if( data.has_object( "tack_item" ) ) {
1798 JsonIn *tack_item_json = data.get_raw( "tack_item" );
1799 item newitem;
1800 newitem.deserialize( *tack_item_json );
1801 tack_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
1802 }
1803 if( data.has_object( "armor_item" ) ) {
1804 JsonIn *armor_item_json = data.get_raw( "armor_item" );
1805 item newitem;
1806 newitem.deserialize( *armor_item_json );
1807 armor_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
1808 }
1809 if( data.has_object( "storage_item" ) ) {
1810 JsonIn *storage_item_json = data.get_raw( "storage_item" );
1811 item newitem;
1812 newitem.deserialize( *storage_item_json );
1813 storage_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
1814 }
1815 if( data.has_object( "battery_item" ) ) {
1816 JsonIn *battery_item_json = data.get_raw( "battery_item" );
1817 item newitem;
1818 newitem.deserialize( *battery_item_json );
1819 battery_item = cata::make_value<item>( newitem );
1820 }
1821 data.read( "hp", hp );
1822
1823 // sp_timeout indicates an old save, prior to the special_attacks refactor
1824 if( data.has_array( "sp_timeout" ) ) {
1825 JsonArray parray = data.get_array( "sp_timeout" );
1826 size_t index = 0;
1827 int ptimeout = 0;
1828 while( parray.has_more() && index < type->special_attacks_names.size() ) {
1829 if( parray.read_next( ptimeout ) ) {
1830 // assume timeouts saved in same order as current monsters.json listing
1831 const std::string &aname = type->special_attacks_names[index++];
1832 auto &entry = special_attacks[aname];
1833 if( ptimeout >= 0 ) {
1834 entry.cooldown = ptimeout;
1835 } else { // -1 means disabled, unclear what <-1 values mean in old saves
1836 entry.cooldown = type->special_attacks.at( aname )->cooldown;
1837 entry.enabled = false;
1838 }
1839 }
1840 }
1841 }
1842
1843 // special_attacks indicates a save after the special_attacks refactor
1844 if( data.has_object( "special_attacks" ) ) {
1845 for( const JsonMember member : data.get_object( "special_attacks" ) ) {
1846 JsonObject saobject = member.get_object();
1847 saobject.allow_omitted_members();
1848 auto &entry = special_attacks[member.name()];
1849 entry.cooldown = saobject.get_int( "cooldown" );
1850 entry.enabled = saobject.get_bool( "enabled" );
1851 }
1852 }
1853
1854 // make sure the loaded monster has every special attack its type says it should have
1855 for( auto &sa : type->special_attacks ) {
1856 const std::string &aname = sa.first;
1857 if( special_attacks.find( aname ) == special_attacks.end() ) {
1858 auto &entry = special_attacks[aname];
1859 entry.cooldown = rng( 0, sa.second->cooldown );
1860 }
1861 }
1862
1863 data.read( "friendly", friendly );
1864 data.read( "mission_id", mission_id );
1865 data.read( "no_extra_death_drops", no_extra_death_drops );
1866 data.read( "dead", dead );
1867 data.read( "anger", anger );
1868 data.read( "morale", morale );
1869 data.read( "hallucination", hallucination );
1870 data.read( "stairscount", staircount ); // really?
1871 data.read( "fish_population", fish_population );
1872 // Load legacy plans.
1873 std::vector<tripoint> plans;
1874 data.read( "plans", plans );
1875 if( !plans.empty() ) {
1876 goal = plans.back();
1877 }
1878
1879 data.read( "summon_time_limit", summon_time_limit );
1880
1881 // This is relative to the monster so it isn't invalidated by map shifting.
1882 tripoint destination;
1883 data.read( "destination", destination );
1884 goal = pos() + destination;
1885
1886 upgrades = data.get_bool( "upgrades", type->upgrades );
1887 upgrade_time = data.get_int( "upgrade_time", -1 );
1888
1889 reproduces = data.get_bool( "reproduces", type->reproduces );
1890 baby_timer.reset();
1891 data.read( "baby_timer", baby_timer );
1892 if( baby_timer && *baby_timer == calendar::before_time_starts ) {
1893 baby_timer.reset();
1894 }
1895
1896 data.read( "udder_timer", udder_timer );
1897
1898 horde_attraction = static_cast<monster_horde_attraction>( data.get_int( "horde_attraction", 0 ) );
1899
1900 data.read( "inv", inv );
1901 data.read( "corpse_components", corpse_components );
1902 data.read( "dragged_foe_id", dragged_foe_id );
1903
1904 if( data.has_int( "ammo" ) && !type->starting_ammo.empty() ) {
1905 // Legacy loading for ammo.
1906 normalize_ammo( data.get_int( "ammo" ) );
1907 } else {
1908 data.read( "ammo", ammo );
1909 // legacy loading for milkable creatures, fix mismatch.
1910 if( has_flag( MF_MILKABLE ) && !type->starting_ammo.empty() && !ammo.empty() &&
1911 type->starting_ammo.begin()->first != ammo.begin()->first ) {
1912 const itype_id old_type = ammo.begin()->first;
1913 const int old_value = ammo.begin()->second;
1914 ammo[type->starting_ammo.begin()->first] = old_value;
1915 ammo.erase( old_type );
1916 }
1917 }
1918
1919 faction = mfaction_str_id( data.get_string( "faction", "" ) );
1920 if( !data.read( "last_updated", last_updated ) ) {
1921 last_updated = calendar::turn;
1922 }
1923 data.read( "mounted_player_id", mounted_player_id );
1924 data.read( "path", path );
1925}

bool monster::make_fungus ( )

Makes this monster into a fungus version Returns false if no such monster exists Returns true if monster is immune to spores, or if it has been fungalized.

1376{
1377 int hitspread = target.deal_melee_attack( this, melee::melee_hit_range( accuracy ) );
1378 mod_moves( -type->attack_cost );
1379 if( type->melee_dice == 0 ) {
1380 // We don't attack, so just return
1381 return;
1382 }
1383

1385 // This happens sometimes
1386 return;
1387 }
1388
1389 if( target.is_player() ||
1390 ( target.is_npc() && g->u.attitude_to( target ) == A_FRIENDLY ) ) {
1391 // Make us a valid target for a few turns
1392 add_effect( effect_hit_by_player, 3_turns );
1393 }
1394
1395 if( has_flag( MF_HIT_AND_RUN ) ) {
1396 add_effect( effect_run, 4_turns );
1397 }
1398

1400

1403 damage.add_damage( DT_BASH, dice( type->melee_dice, type->melee_sides ) );
1404 }
1405

1407

1410 }
1411 body_part bp_hit = dealt_dam.bp_hit;
1412

1425 }
1426 } else if( target.is_player() ) {
1427 add_msg( _( "You dodge an attack from an unseen source." ) );
1428 }
1429 } else if( is_hallucination() || total_dealt > 0 ) {
1430 // Hallucinations always produce messages but never actually deal damage
1431 if( u_see_me ) {
1432 if( target.is_player() ) {
1433 sfx::play_variant_sound( "melee_attack", "monster_melee_hit",
1434 sfx::get_heard_volume( target.pos() ) );
1435 sfx::do_player_death_hurt( dynamic_cast<player &>( target ), false );
1436 //~ 1$s is attacker name, 2$s is bodypart name in accusative.
1437 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s hits your %2$s." ), name(),
1438 body_part_name_accusative( bp_hit ) );
1439 } else if( target.is_npc() ) {
1440 if( has_effect( effect_ridden ) && has_flag( MF_RIDEABLE_MECH ) && pos() == g->u.pos() ) {
1441 //~ %1$s: name of your mount, %2$s: target NPC name, %3$d: damage value
1442 add_msg( m_good, _( "Your %1$s hits %2$s for %3$d damage!" ), name(), target.disp_name(),
1443 total_dealt );
1444 } else {
1445 //~ %1$s: attacker name, %2$s: target NPC name, %3$s: bodypart name in accusative
1446 add_msg( _( "The %1$s hits %2$s %3$s." ), name(),
1447 target.disp_name( true ),
1448 body_part_name_accusative( bp_hit ) );
1449 }
1450 } else {
1451 if( has_effect( effect_ridden ) && has_flag( MF_RIDEABLE_MECH ) && pos() == g->u.pos() ) {
1452 //~ %1$s: name of your mount, %2$s: target creature name, %3$d: damage value
1453 add_msg( m_good, _( "Your %1$s hits %2$s for %3$d damage!" ), get_name(), target.disp_name(),
1454 total_dealt );
1455 } else {
1456 //~ %1$s: attacker name, %2$s: target creature name
1457 add_msg( _( "The %1$s hits %2$s!" ), name(), target.disp_name() );
1458 }
1459 }
1460 } else if( target.is_player() ) {
1461 //~ %s is bodypart name in accusative.
1462 add_msg( m_bad, _( "Something hits your %s." ),
1463 body_part_name_accusative( bp_hit ) );
1464 }
1465 } else {
1466 // No damage dealt
1467 if( u_see_me ) {
1468 if( target.is_player() ) {
1469 //~ 1$s is attacker name, 2$s is bodypart name in accusative, 3$s is armor name
1470 add_msg( _( "The %1$s hits your %2$s, but your %3$s protects you." ), name(),
1471 body_part_name_accusative( bp_hit ), target.skin_name() );
1472 } else if( target.is_npc() ) {
1473 //~ $1s is monster name, %2$s is that monster target name,
1474 //~ $3s is target bodypart name in accusative, $4s is the monster target name,
1475 //~ 5$s is target armor name.
1476 add_msg( _( "The %1$s hits %2$s %3$s but is stopped by %4$s %5$s." ), name(),
1477 target.disp_name( true ),
1478 body_part_name_accusative( bp_hit ),
1479 target.disp_name( true ),
1480 target.skin_name() );
1481 } else {
1482 //~ $1s is monster name, %2$s is that monster target name,
1483 //~ $3s is target armor name.
1484 add_msg( _( "The %1$s hits %2$s but is stopped by its %3$s." ),
1485 name(),
1486 target.disp_name(),
1487 target.skin_name() );
1488 }
1489 } else if( target.is_player() ) {
1490 //~ 1$s is bodypart name in accusative, 2$s is armor name.
1491 add_msg( _( "Something hits your %1$s, but your %2$s protects you." ),
1492 body_part_name_accusative( bp_hit ), target.skin_name() );
1493 }
1494 }
1495
1496 target.check_dead_state();
1497
1498 if( is_hallucination() ) {
1499 if( one_in( 7 ) ) {
1500 die( nullptr );
1501 }
1502 return;
1503 }
1504
1505 if( total_dealt <= 0 ) {
1506 return;
1507 }
1508
1509 // Add any on damage effects
1510 for( const auto &eff : type->atk_effs ) {
1511 if( x_in_y( eff.chance, 100 ) ) {
1512 const body_part affected_bp = eff.affect_hit_bp ? bp_hit : eff.bp;
1513 target.add_effect( eff.id, time_duration::from_turns( eff.duration ), affected_bp );
1514 if( eff.permanent ) {
1515 target.get_effect( eff.id, affected_bp ).set_permanent();
1516 }
1517 }
1518 }
1519
1520 const int stab_cut = dealt_dam.type_damage( DT_CUT ) + dealt_dam.type_damage( DT_STAB );
1521
1522 if( stab_cut > 0 && has_flag( MF_VENOM ) ) {
1523 target.add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You're envenomed!" ) );
1524 target.add_effect( effect_poison, 3_minutes );
1525 }
1526
1527 if( stab_cut > 0 && has_flag( MF_BADVENOM ) ) {
1528 target.add_msg_if_player( m_bad,
1529 _( "You feel venom flood your body, wracking you with pain…" ) );
1530 target.add_effect( effect_badpoison, 4_minutes );
1531 }
1532
1533 if( stab_cut > 0 && has_flag( MF_PARALYZE ) ) {
1534 target.add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "You feel venom enter your body!" ) );
1535 target.add_effect( effect_paralyzepoison, 10_minutes );
1536 }
1537
1538 if( total_dealt > 6 && stab_cut > 0 && has_flag( MF_BLEED ) ) {
1539 // Maybe should only be if DT_CUT > 6... Balance question
1540 target.add_effect( effect_bleed, 6_minutes, bp_hit );
1541 }

◆ move()

void monster::move ( )

Definition at line 632 of file monmove.cpp.

633{
634 // We decrement wandf no matter what. We'll save our wander_to plans until
635 // after we finish out set_dest plans, UNLESS they time out first.
636 if( wandf > 0 ) {
637 wandf--;
638 }
639
640 //Hallucinations have a chance of disappearing each turn
641 if( is_hallucination() && one_in( 25 ) ) {
642 die( nullptr );
643 return;
644 }
645 map &here = get_map();
646
647 behavior::monster_oracle_t oracle( this );
648 behavior::tree goals;
649 goals.add( type->get_goals() );
650 std::string action = goals.tick( &oracle );
651 //The monster can consume objects it stands on. Check if there are any.
652 //If there are. Consume them.
653 // TODO: Stick this in a map and dispatch to it via the action string.
654 if( action == "consume_items" ) {
655 if( g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
656 add_msg( _( "The %s flows around the objects on the floor and they are quickly dissolved!" ),
657 name() );
658 }
659 static const auto volume_per_hp = 250_ml;
660 for( auto &elem : g->m.i_at( pos() ) ) {
661 hp += elem.volume() / volume_per_hp; // Yeah this means it can get more HP than normal.
662 if( has_flag( MF_ABSORBS_SPLITS ) ) {
663 while( hp / 2 > type->hp ) {
664 monster *const spawn = g->place_critter_around( type->id, pos(), 1 );
665 if( !spawn ) {
666 break;
667 }
668 hp -= type->hp;
669 //this is a new copy of the monster. Ideally we should copy the stats/effects that affect the parent
670 spawn->make_ally( *this );
671 if( g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
672 add_msg( _( "The %s splits in two!" ), name() );
673 }
674 }
675 }
676 }
677 g->m.i_clear( pos() );
678 }
679 // record position before moving to put the player there if we're dragging
680 tripoint drag_to = g->m.getabs( pos() );
681
682 const bool pacified = has_effect( effect_pacified );
683
684 // First, use the special attack, if we can!
685 // The attack may change `monster::special_attacks` (e.g. by transforming
686 // this into another monster type). Therefore we can not iterate over it
687 // directly and instead iterate over the map from the monster type
688 // (properties of monster types should never change).
689 for( const auto &sp_type : type->special_attacks ) {
690 const std::string &special_name = sp_type.first;
691 const auto local_iter = special_attacks.find( special_name );
692 if( local_iter == special_attacks.end() ) {
693 continue;
694 }
695 mon_special_attack &local_attack_data = local_iter->second;
696 if( !local_attack_data.enabled ) {
697 continue;
698 }
699
700 // Cooldowns are decremented in monster::process_turn
701
702 if( local_attack_data.cooldown == 0 && !pacified && !is_hallucination() ) {
703 if( !sp_type.second->call( *this ) ) {
704 continue;
705 }
706
707 // `special_attacks` might have changed at this point. Sadly `reset_special`
708 // doesn't check the attack name, so we need to do it here.
709 if( special_attacks.count( special_name ) == 0 ) {
710 continue;
711 }
712 reset_special( special_name );
713 }
714 }
715
716 // Check if they're dragging a foe and find their hapless victim
717 player *dragged_foe = find_dragged_foe();
718
719 // Give nursebots a chance to do surgery.
720 nursebot_operate( dragged_foe );
721
722 // The monster can sometimes hang in air due to last fall being blocked
723 if( !flies() && g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, pos() ) ) {
724 g->m.creature_on_trap( *this, false );
725 if( is_dead() ) {
726 return;
727 }
728 }
729
730 // if the monster is in a deep water tile, it has a chance to drown
731 if( die_if_drowning( pos(), 10 ) ) {
732 return;
733 }
734
735 if( moves < 0 ) {
736 return;
737 }
738
739 // TODO: Move this to attack_at/move_to/etc. functions
740 bool attacking = false;
741 if( !move_effects( attacking ) ) {
742 moves = 0;
743 return;
744 }
745 if( has_flag( MF_IMMOBILE ) || has_flag( MF_RIDEABLE_MECH ) ) {
746 moves = 0;
747 return;
748 }
749 if( has_effect( effect_stunned ) ) {
750 stumble();
751 moves = 0;
752 return;
753 }
754 if( friendly > 0 ) {
755 --friendly;
756 }
757 if( has_effect( effect_ai_waiting ) ) {
758 moves = 0;
759 return;
760 }
761
762 // don't move if a passenger in a moving vehicle
763 auto vp = g->m.veh_at( pos() );
764 bool harness_part = static_cast<bool>( g->m.veh_at( pos() ).part_with_feature( "ANIMAL_CTRL",
765 true ) );
766 if( vp && vp->vehicle().is_moving() && vp->vehicle().get_pet( vp->part_index() ) ) {
767 moves = 0;
768 return;
769 // Don't move if harnessed, even if vehicle is stationary
770 } else if( vp && has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
771 moves = 0;
772 return;
773 // If harnessed monster finds itself moved from the harness point, the harness probably broke!
774 } else if( !harness_part && has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
775 remove_effect( effect_harnessed );
776 }
777 // Set attitude to attitude to our current target
778 monster_attitude current_attitude = attitude( nullptr );
779 if( !wander() ) {
780 if( goal == g->u.pos() ) {
781 current_attitude = attitude( &g->u );
782 } else {
783 for( const npc &guy : g->all_npcs() ) {
784 if( goal == guy.pos() ) {
785 current_attitude = attitude( &guy );
786 }
787 }
788 }
789 }
790
791 if( current_attitude == MATT_IGNORE ||
792 ( current_attitude == MATT_FOLLOW && rl_dist( pos(), goal ) <= MONSTER_FOLLOW_DIST ) ) {
793 moves -= 100;
794 stumble();
795 return;
796 }
797
798 bool moved = false;
799 tripoint destination;
800
801 bool try_to_move = false;
802 for( const tripoint &dest : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 1 ) ) {
803 if( dest != pos() ) {
804 if( can_move_to( dest ) &&
805 g->critter_at( dest, true ) == nullptr ) {
806 try_to_move = true;
807 break;
808 }
809 }
810 }
811 // If true, don't try to greedily avoid locally bad paths
812 bool pathed = false;
813 if( try_to_move ) {
814 if( !wander() ) {
815 while( !path.empty() && path.front() == pos() ) {
816 path.erase( path.begin() );
817 }
818
819 const auto &pf_settings = get_pathfinding_settings();
820 if( pf_settings.max_dist >= rl_dist( pos(), goal ) &&
821 ( path.empty() || rl_dist( pos(), path.front() ) >= 2 || path.back() != goal ) ) {
822 // We need a new path
823 path = g->m.route( pos(), goal, pf_settings, get_path_avoid() );
824 }
825
826 // Try to respect old paths, even if we can't pathfind at the moment
827 if( !path.empty() && path.back() == goal ) {
828 destination = path.front();
829 moved = true;
830 pathed = true;
831 } else {
832 // Straight line forward, probably because we can't pathfind (well enough)
833 destination = goal;
834 moved = true;
835 }
836 }
837 }
838 if( !moved && has_flag( MF_SMELLS ) ) {
839 // No sight... or our plans are invalid (e.g. moving through a transparent, but
840 // solid, square of terrain). Fall back to smell if we have it.
841 unset_dest();
842 tripoint tmp = scent_move();
843 if( tmp.x != -1 ) {
844 destination = tmp;
845 moved = true;
846 }
847 }
848 if( wandf > 0 && !moved && friendly == 0 ) { // No LOS, no scent, so as a fall-back follow sound
849 unset_dest();
850 if( wander_pos != pos() ) {
851 destination = wander_pos;
852 moved = true;
853 }
854 }
855
856 if( !g->m.has_zlevels() ) {
857 // Otherwise weird things happen
858 destination.z = posz();
859 }
860
861 point new_d( destination.xy() - pos().xy() );
862
863 // toggle facing direction for sdl flip
864 if( !tile_iso ) {
865 if( new_d.x < 0 ) {
866 facing = FD_LEFT;
867 } else if( new_d.x > 0 ) {
868 facing = FD_RIGHT;
869 }
870 } else {
871 if( new_d.y <= 0 && new_d.x <= 0 ) {
872 facing = FD_LEFT;
873 }
874 if( new_d.x >= 0 && new_d.y >= 0 ) {
875 facing = FD_RIGHT;
876 }
877 }
878
879 tripoint next_step;
880 const bool can_open_doors = has_flag( MF_CAN_OPEN_DOORS );
881 const bool staggers = has_flag( MF_STUMBLES );
882 if( moved ) {
883 // Implement both avoiding obstacles and staggering.
884 moved = false;
885 float switch_chance = 0.0;
886 const bool can_bash = bash_skill() > 0;
887 // This is a float and using trig_dist() because that Does the Right Thing(tm)
888 // in both circular and roguelike distance modes.
889 const float distance_to_target = trig_dist( pos(), destination );
890 for( tripoint &candidate : squares_closer_to( pos(), destination ) ) {
891 bool via_ramp = false;
892 if( here.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_UP, candidate ) ) {
893 via_ramp = true;
894 candidate.z += 1;
895 } else if( here.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, candidate ) ) {
896 via_ramp = true;
897 candidate.z -= 1;
898 }
899 tripoint candidate_abs = g->m.getabs( candidate );
900
901 if( candidate.z != posz() ) {
902 bool can_z_move = true;
903 if( !here.valid_move( pos(), candidate, false, true, via_ramp ) ) {
904 // Can't phase through floor
905 can_z_move = false;
906 }
907
908 // If we're trying to go up but can't fly, check if we can climb. If we can't, then don't
909 // This prevents non-climb/fly enemies running up walls
910 if( candidate.z > posz() && !( via_ramp || flies() ) ) {
911 if( !can_climb() || !here.has_floor_or_support( candidate ) ) {
912 // Can't "jump" up a whole z-level
913 can_z_move = false;
914 }
915 }
916
917 // Last chance - we can still do the z-level stair teleport bullshit that isn't removed yet
918 // TODO: Remove z-level stair bullshit teleport after aligning all stairs
919 if( !can_z_move &&
920 posx() / ( SEEX * 2 ) == candidate.x / ( SEEX * 2 ) &&
921 posy() / ( SEEY * 2 ) == candidate.y / ( SEEY * 2 ) ) {
922 const tripoint &upper = candidate.z > posz() ? candidate : pos();
923 const tripoint &lower = candidate.z > posz() ? pos() : candidate;
924 if( g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, upper ) && g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_UP, lower ) ) {
925 can_z_move = true;
926 }
927 }
928
929 if( !can_z_move ) {
930 continue;
931 }
932 }
933
934 // A flag to allow non-stumbling critters to stumble when the most direct choice is bad.
935 bool bad_choice = false;
936
937 const Creature *target = g->critter_at( candidate, is_hallucination() );
938 if( target != nullptr ) {
939 const Creature::Attitude att = attitude_to( *target );
940 if( att == A_HOSTILE ) {
941 // When attacking an adjacent enemy, we're direct.
942 moved = true;
943 next_step = candidate_abs;
944 break;
945 } else if( att == A_FRIENDLY && ( target->is_player() || target->is_npc() ) ) {
946 continue; // Friendly firing the player or an NPC is illegal for gameplay reasons
947 } else if( !has_flag( MF_ATTACKMON ) && !has_flag( MF_PUSH_MON ) ) {
948 // Bail out if there's a non-hostile monster in the way and we're not pushy.
949 continue;
950 }
951 // Friendly fire and pushing are always bad choices - they take a lot of time
952 bad_choice = true;
953 }
954
955 map &here = g->m;
956 // is there an openable door?
957 if( can_open_doors &&
958 here.open_door( candidate, !here.is_outside( pos() ), true ) ) {
959 moved = true;
960 next_step = candidate_abs;
961 continue;
962 }
963
964 // Try to shove vehicle out of the way
965 shove_vehicle( destination, candidate );
966 // Bail out if we can't move there and we can't bash.
967 if( !pathed && !can_move_to( candidate ) ) {
968 if( !can_bash ) {
969 continue;
970 }
971 // Don't bash if we're just tracking a noise.
972 if( wander() && destination == wander_pos ) {
973 continue;
974 }
975 const int estimate = here.bash_rating( bash_estimate(), candidate );
976 if( estimate <= 0 ) {
977 continue;
978 }
979
980 if( estimate < 5 ) {
981 bad_choice = true;
982 }
983 }
984
985 const float progress = distance_to_target - trig_dist( candidate, destination );
986 // The x2 makes the first (and most direct) path twice as likely,
987 // since the chance of switching is 1/1, 1/4, 1/6, 1/8
988 switch_chance += progress * 2;
989 // Randomly pick one of the viable squares to move to weighted by distance.
990 if( progress > 0 && ( !moved || x_in_y( progress, switch_chance ) ) ) {
991 moved = true;
992 next_step = candidate_abs;
993 // If we stumble, pick a random square, otherwise take the first one,
994 // which is the most direct path.
995 // Except if the direct path is bad, then check others
996 // Or if the path is given by pathfinder
997 if( !staggers && ( !bad_choice || pathed ) ) {
998 break;
999 }
1000 }
1001 }
1002 }
1003 // Finished logic section. By this point, we should have chosen a square to
1004 // move to (moved = true).
1005 const tripoint local_next_step = g->m.getlocal( next_step );
1006 if( moved ) { // Actual effects of moving to the square we've chosen
1007 const bool did_something =
1008 ( !pacified && attack_at( local_next_step ) ) ||
1009 ( !pacified && can_open_doors && g->m.open_door( local_next_step, !g->m.is_outside( pos() ) ) ) ||
1010 ( !pacified && bash_at( local_next_step ) ) ||
1011 ( !pacified && push_to( local_next_step, 0, 0 ) ) ||
1012 move_to( local_next_step, false, false, get_stagger_adjust( pos(), destination, local_next_step ) );
1013
1014 if( !did_something ) {
1015 moves -= 100; // If we don't do this, we'll get infinite loops.
1016 }
1017 if( has_effect( effect_dragging ) && dragged_foe != nullptr ) {
1018
1019 if( !dragged_foe->has_effect( effect_grabbed ) ) {
1020 dragged_foe = nullptr;
1021 remove_effect( effect_dragging );
1022 } else if( g->m.getlocal( drag_to ) != pos() &&
1023 g->critter_at( g->m.getlocal( drag_to ) ) == nullptr ) {
1024 dragged_foe->setpos( g->m.getlocal( drag_to ) );
1025 }
1026 }
1027 } else {
1028 moves -= 100;
1029 stumble();
1030 path.clear();
1031 }
1032}
tile_iso
bool tile_iso
Using isometric tileset.
Definition: cached_options.cpp:15

Returns true if a creature could walk from from to to in one step.

Returns a success rating from -1 to 10 for a given tile based on a set strength, used for AI movement...

Definition: monster.h:45

bool push_to(const tripoint &p, int boost, size_t depth)
Try to push away whatever occupies p, then step in.

Stumble in a random direction, but with some caveats.

Processes effects which may prevent the monster from moving (bear traps, crushed, etc....
Definition: monster.cpp:1661
monster::move_to
bool move_to(const tripoint &p, bool force=false, bool step_on_critter=false, float stagger_adjustment=1.0)
Attempt to move to p.
Definition: monmove.cpp:1493

Try to smash/bash/destroy your way through the terrain at p.

Definition: monster.cpp:481

Definition: monmove.cpp:2021

References _, Creature::A_FRIENDLY, Creature::A_HOSTILE, action, behavior::tree::add(), add_msg(), attack_at(), attitude(), attitude_to(), bash_at(), bash_estimate(), map::bash_rating(), bash_skill(), can_climb(), can_move_to(), mon_special_attack::cooldown, die(), die_if_drowning(), effect_ai_waiting, effect_dragging, effect_grabbed, effect_harnessed, effect_pacified, effect_stunned, mon_special_attack::enabled, Creature::facing, FD_LEFT, FD_RIGHT, find_dragged_foe(), flies(), friendly, g, mtype::get_goals(), get_map(), get_path_avoid(), get_pathfinding_settings(), get_stagger_adjust(), goal, Creature::has_effect(), map::has_flag(), has_flag(), map::has_floor_or_support(), hp, mtype::hp, mtype::id, is_dead(), is_hallucination(), Creature::is_npc(), map::is_outside(), Creature::is_player(), MATT_FOLLOW, MATT_IGNORE, MF_ABSORBS_SPLITS, MF_ATTACKMON, MF_CAN_OPEN_DOORS, MF_IMMOBILE, MF_PUSH_MON, MF_RIDEABLE_MECH, MF_SMELLS, MF_STUMBLES, MONSTER_FOLLOW_DIST, move_effects(), move_to(), Creature::moves, name(), nursebot_operate(), one_in(), map::open_door(), path, pos(), posx(), posy(), posz(), push_to(), Creature::remove_effect(), reset_special(), rl_dist(), scent_move(), SEEX, SEEY, Character::setpos(), shove_vehicle(), spawn(), special_attacks, mtype::special_attacks, squares_closer_to(), stumble(), TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, TFLAG_GOES_UP, TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, TFLAG_RAMP_UP, behavior::tree::tick(), tile_iso, trig_dist(), type, unset_dest(), map::valid_move(), wander(), wander_pos, wandf, point::x, tripoint::x, x_in_y(), tripoint::xy(), point::y, and tripoint::z.

◆ move_effects()

bool monster::move_effects ( bool  attacking)
overridevirtual

Processes effects which may prevent the monster from moving (bear traps, crushed, etc.).

Returns false if movement is stopped.

Implements Creature.

Definition at line 1661 of file monster.cpp.

1662{
1663 // This function is relatively expensive, we want that cached
1664 // IMPORTANT: If adding any new effects here, make SURE to
1665 // add them to hardcoded_movement_impairing in effect.cpp
1666 if( !effect_cache[MOVEMENT_IMPAIRED] ) {
1667 return true;
1668 }
1669
1670 bool u_see_me = g->u.sees( *this );
1671 if( has_effect( effect_tied ) ) {
1672 // friendly pet, will stay tied down and obey.
1673 if( friendly == -1 ) {
1674 return false;
1675 }
1676 // non-friendly monster will struggle to get free occasionally.
1677 // some monsters can't be tangled up with a net/bolas/lasso etc.
1678 bool immediate_break = type->in_species( FISH ) || type->in_species( MOLLUSK ) ||
1679 type->in_species( ROBOT ) || type->bodytype == "snake" || type->bodytype == "blob";
1680 if( !immediate_break && rng( 0, 900 ) > type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides * 1.5 ) {
1681 if( u_see_me ) {
1682 add_msg( _( "The %s struggles to break free of its bonds." ), name() );
1683 }
1684 } else if( immediate_break ) {
1685 remove_effect( effect_tied );
1686 if( tied_item ) {
1687 if( u_see_me ) {
1688 add_msg( _( "The %s easily slips out of its bonds." ), name() );
1689 }
1690 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos(), *tied_item );
1691 tied_item.reset();
1692 }
1693 } else {
1694 if( tied_item ) {
1695 const bool broken = rng( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, std::min( 10000,
1696 type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides * 250 ) ) > 800;
1697 if( !broken ) {
1698 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos(), *tied_item );
1699 }
1700 tied_item.reset();
1701 if( u_see_me ) {
1702 if( broken ) {
1703 add_msg( _( "The %s snaps the bindings holding it down." ), name() );
1704 } else {
1705 add_msg( _( "The %s breaks free of the bindings holding it down." ), name() );
1706 }
1707 }
1708 }
1709 remove_effect( effect_tied );
1710 }
1711 return false;
1712 }
1713 if( has_effect( effect_downed ) ) {
1714 if( rng( 0, 40 ) > type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides * 1.5 ) {
1715 if( u_see_me ) {
1716 add_msg( _( "The %s struggles to stand." ), name() );
1717 }
1718 } else {
1719 if( u_see_me ) {
1720 add_msg( _( "The %s climbs to its feet!" ), name() );
1721 }
1722 remove_effect( effect_downed );
1723 }
1724 return false;
1725 }
1726 if( has_effect( effect_webbed ) ) {
1727 if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 6 * get_effect_int( effect_webbed ) ) ) {
1728 if( u_see_me ) {
1729 add_msg( _( "The %s breaks free of the webs!" ), name() );
1730 }
1731 remove_effect( effect_webbed );
1732 }
1733 return false;
1734 }
1735 if( has_effect( effect_lightsnare ) ) {
1736 if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 12 ) ) {
1737 remove_effect( effect_lightsnare );
1738 g->m.spawn_item( pos(), "string_36" );
1739 g->m.spawn_item( pos(), "snare_trigger" );
1740 if( u_see_me ) {
1741 add_msg( _( "The %s escapes the light snare!" ), name() );
1742 }
1743 }
1744 return false;
1745 }
1746 if( has_effect( effect_heavysnare ) ) {
1747 if( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides >= 7 ) {
1748 if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 32 ) ) {
1749 remove_effect( effect_heavysnare );
1750 g->m.spawn_item( pos(), "rope_6" );
1751 g->m.spawn_item( pos(), "snare_trigger" );
1752 if( u_see_me ) {
1753 add_msg( _( "The %s escapes the heavy snare!" ), name() );
1754 }
1755 }
1756 }
1757 return false;
1758 }
1759 if( has_effect( effect_beartrap ) ) {
1760 if( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides >= 18 ) {
1761 if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 200 ) ) {
1762 remove_effect( effect_beartrap );
1763 g->m.spawn_item( pos(), "beartrap" );
1764 if( u_see_me ) {
1765 add_msg( _( "The %s escapes the bear trap!" ), name() );
1766 }
1767 }
1768 }
1769 return false;
1770 }
1771 if( has_effect( effect_crushed ) ) {
1772 if( x_in_y( type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides, 100 ) ) {
1773 remove_effect( effect_crushed );
1774 if( u_see_me ) {
1775 add_msg( _( "The %s frees itself from the rubble!" ), name() );
1776 }
1777 }
1778 return false;
1779 }
1780
1781 // If we ever get more effects that force movement on success this will need to be reworked to
1782 // only trigger success effects if /all/ rolls succeed
1783 if( has_effect( effect_in_pit ) ) {
1784 if( rng( 0, 40 ) > type->melee_dice * type->melee_sides ) {
1785 return false;
1786 } else {
1787 if( u_see_me ) {
1788 add_msg( _( "The %s escapes the pit!" ), name() );
1789 }
1790 remove_effect( effect_in_pit );
1791 }
1792 }
1793 if( has_effect( effect_grabbed ) ) {
1794 if( dice( type->melee_dice + type->melee_sides, 3 ) < get_effect_int( effect_grabbed ) ||
1795 !one_in( 4 ) ) {
1796 return false;
1797 } else {
1798 if( u_see_me ) {
1799 add_msg( _( "The %s breaks free from the grab!" ), name() );
1800 }
1801 remove_effect( effect_grabbed );
1802 }
1803 }
1804 return true;
1805}

◆ move_to()

bool monster::move_to ( const tripoint &  p,
bool  force = false,
bool  step_on_critter = false,
float  stagger_adjustment = 1.0 
)

Attempt to move to p.

If there's something blocking the movement, such as infinite move costs at the target, an existing NPC or monster, this function simply aborts and does nothing.

Parameters
pDestination of movement
forceIf this is set to true, the movement will happen even if there's currently something, else than a creature, blocking the destination.
step_on_critterIf this is set to true, the movement will happen even if there's currently a creature blocking the destination.
stagger_adjustmentis a multiplier for move cost to compensate for staggering.
Returns
true if movement successful, false otherwise

Definition at line 1493 of file monmove.cpp.

1495{
1496 const bool on_ground = !digging() && !flies();
1497
1498 const bool z_move = p.z != pos().z;
1499 const bool going_up = p.z > pos().z;
1500
1501 tripoint destination = p;
1502
1503 // This is stair teleportation hackery.
1504 // TODO: Remove this in favor of stair alignment
1505 if( going_up ) {
1506 if( g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_UP, pos() ) ) {
1507 destination = find_closest_stair( p, TFLAG_GOES_DOWN );
1508 }
1509 } else if( z_move ) {
1510 if( g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_GOES_DOWN, pos() ) ) {
1511 destination = find_closest_stair( p, TFLAG_GOES_UP );
1512 }
1513 }
1514
1515 // Allows climbing monsters to move on terrain with movecost <= 0
1516 Creature *critter = g->critter_at( destination, is_hallucination() );
1517 if( g->m.has_flag( "CLIMBABLE", destination ) ) {
1518 if( g->m.impassable( destination ) && critter == nullptr ) {
1519 if( flies() ) {
1520 moves -= 100;
1521 force = true;
1522 if( g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
1523 add_msg( _( "The %1$s flies over the %2$s." ), name(),
1524 g->m.has_flag_furn( "CLIMBABLE", p ) ? g->m.furnname( p ) :
1525 g->m.tername( p ) );
1526 }
1527 } else if( climbs() ) {
1528 moves -= 150;
1529 force = true;
1530 if( g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
1531 add_msg( _( "The %1$s climbs over the %2$s." ), name(),
1532 g->m.has_flag_furn( "CLIMBABLE", p ) ? g->m.furnname( p ) :
1533 g->m.tername( p ) );
1534 }
1535 }
1536 }
1537 }
1538
1539 if( critter != nullptr && !step_on_critter ) {
1540 return false;
1541 }
1542
1543 // Make sure that we can move there, unless force is true.
1544 if( !force && !can_move_to( destination ) ) {
1545 return false;
1546 }
1547
1548 if( !force ) {
1549 // This adjustment is to make it so that monster movement speed relative to the player
1550 // is consistent even if the monster stumbles,
1551 // and the same regardless of the distance measurement mode.
1552 // Note: Keep this as float here or else it will cancel valid moves
1553 const float cost = stagger_adjustment *
1554 static_cast<float>( climbs() &&
1555 g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, p ) ? calc_climb_cost( pos(), destination ) : calc_movecost( pos(),
1556 destination ) );
1557 if( cost > 0.0f ) {
1558 moves -= static_cast<int>( std::ceil( cost ) );
1559 } else {
1560 return false;
1561 }
1562 }
1563
1564 //Check for moving into/out of water
1565 bool was_water = g->m.is_divable( pos() );
1566 bool will_be_water = on_ground && can_submerge() && g->m.is_divable( destination );
1567
1568 // Attitude check is kinda slow, better gate it
1569 if( was_water != will_be_water && !flies() ) {
1570 if( attitude( &g->u ) != MATT_ATTACK ) {
1571 // Nothing, no need to spam
1572 } else if( was_water && !will_be_water && g->u.sees( p ) ) {
1573 // Use more dramatic messages for swimming monsters
1574 //~ Message when a monster emerges from water
1575 //~ %1$s: monster name, %2$s: leaps/emerges, %3$s: terrain name
1576 add_msg( m_warning, pgettext( "monster movement", "A %1$s %2$s from the %3$s!" ), name(),
1577 swims() || has_flag( MF_AQUATIC ) ? _( "leaps" ) : _( "emerges" ),
1578 g->m.tername( pos() ) );
1579 } else if( !was_water && will_be_water && g->u.sees( destination ) ) {
1580 //~ Message when a monster enters water
1581 //~ %1$s: monster name, %2$s: dives/sinks, %3$s: terrain name
1582 add_msg( m_warning, pgettext( "monster movement", "A %1$s %2$s into the %3$s!" ), name(),
1583 swims() || has_flag( MF_AQUATIC ) ? _( "dives" ) : _( "sinks" ),
1584 g->m.tername( destination ) );
1585 }
1586 }
1587
1588 setpos( destination );
1589 footsteps( destination );
1590 underwater = will_be_water;
1591 if( is_hallucination() ) {
1592 //Hallucinations don't do any of the stuff after this point
1593 return true;
1594 }
1595
1596 if( type->size != MS_TINY && on_ground ) {
1597 const int sharp_damage = rng( 1, 10 );
1598 const int rough_damage = rng( 1, 2 );
1599 if( g->m.has_flag( "SHARP", pos() ) && !one_in( 4 ) &&
1600 get_armor_cut( bodypart_id( "torso" ) ) < sharp_damage ) {
1601 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), sharp_damage );
1602 }
1603 if( g->m.has_flag( "ROUGH", pos() ) && one_in( 6 ) &&
1604 get_armor_cut( bodypart_id( "torso" ) ) < rough_damage ) {
1605 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), rough_damage );
1606 }
1607 }
1608
1609 if( g->m.has_flag( "UNSTABLE", destination ) && on_ground ) {
1610 add_effect( effect_bouldering, 1_turns, num_bp );
1611 } else if( has_effect( effect_bouldering ) ) {
1612 remove_effect( effect_bouldering );
1613 }
1614
1615 if( g->m.has_flag_ter_or_furn( TFLAG_NO_SIGHT, destination ) && on_ground ) {
1616 add_effect( effect_no_sight, 1_turns, num_bp );
1617 } else if( has_effect( effect_no_sight ) ) {
1618 remove_effect( effect_no_sight );
1619 }
1620
1621 g->m.creature_on_trap( *this );
1622 if( is_dead() ) {
1623 return true;
1624 }
1625 if( !will_be_water && ( digs() || can_dig() ) ) {
1626 underwater = g->m.has_flag( "DIGGABLE", pos() );
1627 }
1628 // Diggers turn the dirt into dirtmound
1629 if( digging() && g->m.has_flag( "DIGGABLE", pos() ) ) {
1630 int factor = 0;
1631 switch( type->size ) {
1632 case MS_TINY:
1633 factor = 100;
1634 break;
1635 case MS_SMALL:
1636 factor = 30;
1637 break;
1638 case MS_MEDIUM:
1639 factor = 6;
1640 break;
1641 case MS_LARGE:
1642 factor = 3;
1643 break;
1644 case MS_HUGE:
1645 factor = 1;
1646 break;
1647 default:
1648 factor = 6;
1649 break;
1650 }
1651 // TODO: make this take terrain type into account so diggers traveling under sand will create mounds of sand etc.
1652 if( one_in( factor ) ) {
1653 g->m.ter_set( pos(), t_dirtmound );
1654 }
1655 }
1656 // Acid trail monsters leave... a trail of acid
1657 if( has_flag( MF_ACIDTRAIL ) ) {
1658 g->m.add_field( pos(), fd_acid, 3 );
1659 }
1660
1661 // Not all acid trail monsters leave as much acid. Every time this monster takes a step, there is a 1/5 chance it will drop a puddle.
1662 if( has_flag( MF_SHORTACIDTRAIL ) ) {
1663 if( one_in( 5 ) ) {
1664 g->m.add_field( pos(), fd_acid, 3 );
1665 }
1666 }
1667
1668 if( has_flag( MF_SLUDGETRAIL ) ) {
1669 for( const tripoint &sludge_p : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 1 ) ) {
1670 const int fstr = 3 - ( std::abs( sludge_p.x - posx() ) + std::abs( sludge_p.y - posy() ) );
1671 if( fstr >= 2 ) {
1672 g->m.add_field( sludge_p, fd_sludge, fstr );
1673 }
1674 }
1675 }
1676
1677 if( has_flag( MF_DRIPS_NAPALM ) ) {
1678 if( one_in( 10 ) ) {
1679 // if it has more napalm, drop some and reduce ammo in tank
1680 if( ammo[itype_pressurized_tank] > 0 ) {
1681 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos(), item( "napalm", calendar::turn, 50 ) );
1682 ammo[itype_pressurized_tank] -= 50;
1683 } else {
1684 // TODO: remove MF_DRIPS_NAPALM flag since no more napalm in tank
1685 // Not possible for now since flag check is done on type, not individual monster
1686 }
1687 }
1688 }
1689 if( has_flag( MF_DRIPS_GASOLINE ) ) {
1690 if( one_in( 5 ) ) {
1691 // TODO: use same idea that limits napalm dripping
1692 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos(), item( "gasoline" ) );
1693 }
1694 }
1695 return true;
1696}

506{
507 std::string ret;

511 ret = _( "thick bark" );

◆ normalize_ammo()

void monster::normalize_ammo ( int  old_ammo)
private

Legacy loading logic for monsters that are packing ammo.

Definition at line 2095 of file monster.cpp.

2096{
2097 int total_ammo = 0;
2098 // Sum up the ammo entries to get a ratio.
2099 for( const auto &ammo_entry : type->starting_ammo ) {
2100 total_ammo += ammo_entry.second;
2101 }
2102 if( total_ammo == 0 ) {
2103 // Should never happen, but protect us from a div/0 if it does.
2104 return;
2105 }
2106 // Previous code gave robots 100 rounds of ammo.
2107 // This reassigns whatever is left from that in the appropriate proportions.
2108 for( const auto &ammo_entry : type->starting_ammo ) {
2109 ammo[ammo_entry.first] = old_ammo * ammo_entry.second / ( 100 * total_ammo );
2110 }
2111}

◆ nursebot_operate()

void monster::nursebot_operate ( player *  dragged_foe)

1058{
1059 // No dragged foe, nothing to do.
1060 if( dragged_foe == nullptr ) {
1061 return;
1062 }
1063
1064 // Nothing to do if they can't operate, or they don't think they're dragging.
1065 if( !( type->has_special_attack( "OPERATE" ) && has_effect( effect_dragging ) ) ) {
1066 return;
1067 }
1068
1069 if( rl_dist( pos(), goal ) == 1 && !g->m.has_flag_furn( flag_AUTODOC_COUCH, goal ) &&
1070 !has_effect( effect_operating ) ) {
1071 if( dragged_foe->has_effect( effect_grabbed ) && !has_effect( effect_countdown ) &&
1072 ( g->critter_at( goal ) == nullptr || g->critter_at( goal ) == dragged_foe ) ) {
1073 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s slowly but firmly puts %2$s down onto the autodoc couch." ), name(),
1074 dragged_foe->disp_name() );
1075
1076 dragged_foe->setpos( goal );
1077
1078 // There's still time to get away
1079 add_effect( effect_countdown, 2_turns );
1080 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %s produces a syringe full of some translucent liquid." ), name() );
1081 } else if( g->critter_at( goal ) != nullptr && has_effect( effect_dragging ) ) {
1082 sounds::sound( pos(), 8, sounds::sound_t::electronic_speech,
1083 string_format(
1084 _( "a soft robotic voice say, \"Please step away from the autodoc, this patient needs immediate care.\"" ) ) );
1085 // TODO: Make it able to push NPC/player
1086 push_to( goal, 4, 0 );
1087 }
1088 }
1089 if( get_effect_dur( effect_countdown ) == 1_turns && !has_effect( effect_operating ) ) {
1090 if( dragged_foe->has_effect( effect_grabbed ) ) {
1091
1092 const bionic_collection &collec = *dragged_foe->my_bionics;
1093 const int index = rng( 0, collec.size() - 1 );
1094 const bionic &target_cbm = collec[index];

1097 const float adjusted_skill = static_cast<float>( 77 ) - std::min( static_cast<float>( 40 ),
1098 static_cast<float>( 77 ) - static_cast<float>( 77 ) / static_cast<float>( 10.0 ) );
1099
1100 g->u.uninstall_bionic( target_cbm, *this, *dragged_foe, adjusted_skill );
1101
1102 dragged_foe->remove_effect( effect_grabbed );
1103 remove_effect( effect_dragging );
1104 dragged_foe_id = character_id();
1105
1106 }
1107 }
1108}

2842 }
2843 if( type->has_fear_trigger( mon_trigger::FRIEND_ATTACKED ) ) {

2854 continue;

◆ on_load()

void monster::on_load ( )

Retroactively update monster.

Call this after a preexisting monster has been placed on map. Don't call for monsters that have been freshly created, it may cause the monster to upgrade itself into another monster type.

Definition at line 2985 of file monster.cpp.

2986{
2987 try_upgrade( false );
2988 try_reproduce();
2989 if( has_flag( MF_MILKABLE ) ) {
2990 refill_udders();
2991 }
2992
2993 const time_duration dt = calendar::turn - last_updated;
2994 last_updated = calendar::turn;
2995 if( dt <= 0_turns ) {
2996 return;
2997 }
2998 float regen = type->regenerates;
2999 if( regen <= 0 ) {
3000 if( has_flag( MF_REVIVES ) ) {
3001 regen = 1.0f / to_turns<int>( 1_hours );
3002 } else if( made_of( material_id( "flesh" ) ) || made_of( material_id( "veggy" ) ) ) {
3003 // Most living stuff here
3004 regen = 0.25f / to_turns<int>( 1_hours );
3005 }
3006 }
3007 const int heal_amount = roll_remainder( regen * to_turns<int>( dt ) );
3008 const int healed = heal( heal_amount );
3009 int healed_speed = 0;
3010 if( healed < heal_amount && get_speed_base() < type->speed ) {
3011 int old_speed = get_speed_base();
3012 set_speed_base( std::min( get_speed_base() + heal_amount - healed, type->speed ) );
3013 healed_speed = get_speed_base() - old_speed;
3014 }
3015
3016 add_msg( m_debug, "on_load() by %s, %d turns, healed %d hp, %d speed",

◆ plan()

void monster::plan ( )

Definition at line 307 of file monmove.cpp.

308{
309 const auto &factions = g->critter_tracker->factions();
310
311 // Bots are more intelligent than most living stuff
312 bool smart_planning = has_flag( MF_PRIORITIZE_TARGETS );
313 Creature *target = nullptr;
314 int max_sight_range = std::max( type->vision_day, type->vision_night );
315 // 8.6f is rating for tank drone 60 tiles away, moose 16 or boomer 33
316 float dist = !smart_planning ? max_sight_range : 8.6f;
317 bool fleeing = false;
318 bool docile = friendly != 0 && has_effect( effect_docile );
319 bool waiting = has_effect( effect_ai_waiting );
320
321 const bool angers_hostile_weak = type->has_anger_trigger( mon_trigger::HOSTILE_WEAK );
322 const int angers_hostile_near = type->has_anger_trigger( mon_trigger::HOSTILE_CLOSE ) ? 5 : 0;
323 const int angers_mating_season = type->has_anger_trigger( mon_trigger::MATING_SEASON ) ? 3 : 0;
324 const int angers_cub_threatened = type->has_anger_trigger( mon_trigger::PLAYER_NEAR_BABY ) ? 8 : 0;
325 const int fears_hostile_near = type->has_fear_trigger( mon_trigger::HOSTILE_CLOSE ) ? 5 : 0;
326
327 bool group_morale = has_flag( MF_GROUP_MORALE ) && morale < type->morale;
328 bool swarms = has_flag( MF_SWARMS );
329 auto mood = attitude();
330
331 // If we can see the player, move toward them or flee, simpleminded animals are too dumb to follow the player.
332 if( friendly == 0 && sees( g->u ) && !has_flag( MF_PET_WONT_FOLLOW ) && !waiting ) {
333 dist = rate_target( g->u, dist, smart_planning );
334 fleeing = fleeing || is_fleeing( g->u );
335 target = &g->u;
336 if( dist <= 5 ) {
337 anger += angers_hostile_near;
338 morale -= fears_hostile_near;
339 if( angers_mating_season > 0 ) {
340 bool mating_angry = false;
341 season_type season = season_of_year( calendar::turn );
342 for( auto &elem : type->baby_flags ) {
343 if( ( season == SUMMER && elem == "SUMMER" ) ||
344 ( season == WINTER && elem == "WINTER" ) ||
345 ( season == SPRING && elem == "SPRING" ) ||
346 ( season == AUTUMN && elem == "AUTUMN" ) ) {
347 mating_angry = true;
348 break;
349 }
350 }
351 if( mating_angry ) {
352 anger += angers_mating_season;
353 }
354 }
355 }
356 if( angers_cub_threatened > 0 ) {
357 for( monster &tmp : g->all_monsters() ) {
358 if( type->baby_monster == tmp.type->id ) {
359 // baby nearby; is the player too close?
360 dist = tmp.rate_target( g->u, dist, smart_planning );
361 if( dist <= 3 ) {
362 //proximity to baby; monster gets furious and less likely to flee
363 anger += angers_cub_threatened;
364 morale += angers_cub_threatened / 2;
365 }
366 }
367 }
368 }
369 } else if( friendly != 0 && !docile && !waiting ) {
370 for( monster &tmp : g->all_monsters() ) {
371 if( tmp.friendly == 0 ) {
372 float rating = rate_target( tmp, dist, smart_planning );
373 if( rating < dist ) {
374 target = &tmp;
375 dist = rating;
376 }
377 }
378 }
379 }
380
381 if( waiting ) {
382 set_dest( pos() );
383 return;
384 }
385
386 if( docile ) {
387 if( friendly != 0 && target != nullptr ) {
388 set_dest( target->pos() );
389 }
390
391 return;
392 }
393
394 int valid_targets = ( target == nullptr ) ? 1 : 0;
395 for( npc &who : g->all_npcs() ) {
396 auto faction_att = faction.obj().attitude( who.get_monster_faction() );
397 if( faction_att == MFA_NEUTRAL || faction_att == MFA_FRIENDLY ) {
398 continue;
399 }
400
401 float rating = rate_target( who, dist, smart_planning );
402 bool fleeing_from = is_fleeing( who );
403 if( rating == dist && ( fleeing || attitude( &who ) == MATT_ATTACK ) ) {
404 ++valid_targets;
405 if( one_in( valid_targets ) ) {
406 target = &who;
407 }
408 }
409 // Switch targets if closer and hostile or scarier than current target
410 if( ( rating < dist && fleeing ) ||
411 ( faction_att == MFA_HATE ) ||
412 ( rating < dist && attitude( &who ) == MATT_ATTACK ) ||
413 ( !fleeing && fleeing_from ) ) {
414 target = &who;
415 dist = rating;
416 valid_targets = 1;
417 }
418 fleeing = fleeing || fleeing_from;
419 if( rating <= 5 ) {
420 anger += angers_hostile_near;
421 morale -= fears_hostile_near;
422 if( angers_mating_season > 0 ) {
423 bool mating_angry = false;
424 season_type season = season_of_year( calendar::turn );
425 for( auto &elem : type->baby_flags ) {
426 if( ( season == SUMMER && elem == "SUMMER" ) ||
427 ( season == WINTER && elem == "WINTER" ) ||
428 ( season == SPRING && elem == "SPRING" ) ||
429 ( season == AUTUMN && elem == "AUTUMN" ) ) {
430 mating_angry = true;
431 break;
432 }
433 }
434 if( mating_angry ) {
435 anger += angers_mating_season;
436 }
437 }
438 }
439 }
440
441 fleeing = fleeing || ( mood == MATT_FLEE );
442 if( friendly == 0 ) {
443 for( const auto &fac : factions ) {
444 auto faction_att = faction.obj().attitude( fac.first );
445 if( faction_att == MFA_NEUTRAL || faction_att == MFA_FRIENDLY ) {
446 continue;
447 }
448
449 for( const weak_ptr_fast<monster> &weak : fac.second ) {
450 const shared_ptr_fast<monster> shared = weak.lock();
451 if( !shared ) {
452 continue;
453 }
454 monster &mon = *shared;
455 float rating = rate_target( mon, dist, smart_planning );
456 if( rating == dist ) {
457 ++valid_targets;
458 if( one_in( valid_targets ) ) {
459 target = &mon;
460 }
461 }
462 if( rating < dist ) {
463 target = &mon;
464 dist = rating;
465 valid_targets = 1;
466 }
467 if( rating <= 5 ) {
468 anger += angers_hostile_near;
469 morale -= fears_hostile_near;
470 }
471 }
472 }
473 }
474
475 // Friendly monsters here
476 // Avoid for hordes of same-faction stuff or it could get expensive
477 const auto actual_faction = friendly == 0 ? faction : mfaction_str_id( "player" );
478 const auto &myfaction_iter = factions.find( actual_faction );
479 if( myfaction_iter == factions.end() ) {
480 DebugLog( DL::Error, DC::Game ) << disp_name() << " tried to find faction "
481 << actual_faction.id().str()
482 << " which wasn't loaded in game::monmove";
483 swarms = false;
484 group_morale = false;
485 }
486 swarms = swarms && target == nullptr; // Only swarm if we have no target
487 if( group_morale || swarms ) {
488 for( const weak_ptr_fast<monster> &weak : myfaction_iter->second ) {
489 const shared_ptr_fast<monster> shared = weak.lock();
490 if( !shared ) {
491 continue;
492 }
493 monster &mon = *shared;
494 float rating = rate_target( mon, dist, smart_planning );
495 if( group_morale && rating <= 10 ) {
496 morale += 10 - rating;
497 }
498 if( swarms ) {
499 if( rating < 5 ) { // Too crowded here
500 wander_pos.x = posx() * rng( 1, 3 ) - mon.posx();
501 wander_pos.y = posy() * rng( 1, 3 ) - mon.posy();
502 wandf = 2;
503 target = nullptr;
504 // Swarm to the furthest ally you can see
505 } else if( rating < FLT_MAX && rating > dist && wandf <= 0 ) {
506 target = &mon;
507 dist = rating;
508 }
509 }
510 }
511 }
512
513 // Operating monster keep you safe while they operate, how nice....
514 if( type->has_special_attack( "OPERATE" ) ) {
515 int prev_friendlyness = friendly;
516 if( has_effect( effect_operating ) ) {
517 friendly = 100;
518 for( auto critter : g->m.get_creatures_in_radius( pos(), 6 ) ) {
519 monster *mon = dynamic_cast<monster *>( critter );
520 if( mon != nullptr && mon->type->in_species( ZOMBIE ) ) {
521 anger = 100;
522 } else {
523 anger = 0;
524 }
525 }
526 } else {
527 friendly = prev_friendlyness;
528 }
529 }
530
531 if( has_effect( effect_dragging ) ) {
532
533 if( type->has_special_attack( "OPERATE" ) ) {
534
535 bool found_path_to_couch = false;
536 tripoint tmp( pos() + point( 12, 12 ) );
537 tripoint couch_loc;
538 for( const auto &couch_pos : g->m.find_furnitures_with_flag_in_radius( pos(), 10,
539 flag_AUTODOC_COUCH ) ) {
540 if( g->m.clear_path( pos(), couch_pos, 10, 0, 100 ) ) {
541 if( rl_dist( pos(), couch_pos ) < rl_dist( pos(), tmp ) ) {
542 tmp = couch_pos;
543 found_path_to_couch = true;
544 couch_loc = couch_pos;
545 }
546 }
547 }
548
549 if( !found_path_to_couch ) {
550 anger = 0;
551 remove_effect( effect_dragging );
552 } else {
553 set_dest( couch_loc );
554 }
555 }
556
557 } else if( target != nullptr ) {
558
559 tripoint dest = target->pos();
560 auto att_to_target = attitude_to( *target );
561 if( att_to_target == Attitude::A_HOSTILE && !fleeing ) {
562 set_dest( dest );
563 } else if( fleeing ) {
564 set_dest( tripoint( posx() * 2 - dest.x, posy() * 2 - dest.y, posz() ) );
565 }
566 if( angers_hostile_weak && att_to_target != Attitude::A_FRIENDLY ) {
567 int hp_per = target->hp_percentage();
568 if( hp_per <= 70 ) {
569 anger += 10 - static_cast<int>( hp_per / 10 );
570 }
571 }
572 } else if( friendly > 0 && one_in( 3 ) ) {
573 // Grow restless with no targets
574 friendly--;
575 } else if( friendly < 0 && sees( g->u ) ) {
576 if( rl_dist( pos(), g->u.pos() ) > 2 ) {
577 set_dest( g->u.pos() );
578 } else {
579 unset_dest();
580 }
581 }

◆ print_info()

int monster::print_info ( const catacurses::window &  w,
int  vStart,
int  vLines,
int  column 
) const
overridevirtual

Write information about this creature.

Parameters
wthe window to print the text into.
vStartvertical start to print, that means the first line to print.
vLinesnumber of lines to print at most (printing less is fine).
columnhorizontal start to print (column), horizontal end is one character before the right border of the window (to keep the border).
Returns
The line just behind the last printed line, that means multiple calls to this can be stacked, the return value is acceptable as vStart for the next call without creating empty lines or overwriting lines.

Implements Creature.
