2511{
2512 // Monster only effects
2513 for( auto &elem : *effects ) {
2514 for( auto &_effect_it : elem.second ) {
2515 if( !_effect_it.second.is_removed() ) {
2516 process_one_effect( _effect_it.second, false );
2517 }
2518 }
2519 }
2520
2521 // Like with player/NPCs - keep the speed above 0
2522 const int min_speed_bonus = -0.75 * get_speed_base();
2523 if( get_speed_bonus() < min_speed_bonus ) {
2524 set_speed_bonus( min_speed_bonus );
2525 }
2526
2527 //If this monster has the ability to heal in combat, do it now.
2528 int regeneration_amount = type->regenerates;
2529 float regen_multiplier = 0;
2530 //Apply effect-triggered regeneration modifiers
2531 for( const auto &regeneration_modifier : type->regeneration_modifiers ) {
2532 if( has_effect( regeneration_modifier.first ) ) {
2533 effect &e = get_effect( regeneration_modifier.first );
2534 regen_multiplier = 1.00 + regeneration_modifier.second.base_modifier +
2535 ( e.get_intensity() - 1 ) * regeneration_modifier.second.scale_modifier;
2536 regeneration_amount = round( regeneration_amount * regen_multiplier );
2537 }
2538 }
2539 //Prevent negative regeneration
2540 if( regeneration_amount < 0 ) {
2541 regeneration_amount = 0;
2542 }
2543 const int healed_amount = heal( round( regeneration_amount ) );
2544 if( healed_amount > 0 && one_in( 2 ) && g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
2545 add_msg( m_debug, ( "Regen: %s" ), healed_amount );
2546 std::string healing_format_string;
2547 if( healed_amount >= 50 ) {
2548 healing_format_string = _( "The %s is visibly regenerating!" );
2549 } else if( healed_amount >= 10 ) {
2550 healing_format_string = _( "The %s seems a little healthier." );
2551 } else {
2552 healing_format_string = _( "The %s is healing slowly." );
2553 }
2554 add_msg( m_warning, healing_format_string, name() );
2555 }
2556
2557 if( type->regenerates_in_dark ) {
2558 const float light = g->m.ambient_light_at( pos() );
2559 // Magic number 10000 was chosen so that a floodlight prevents regeneration in a range of 20 tiles
2560 if( heal( static_cast<int>( 50.0 * std::exp( - light * light / 10000 ) ) > 0 && one_in( 2 ) &&
2561 g->u.sees( *this ) ) ) {
2562 add_msg( m_warning, _( "The %s uses the darkness to regenerate." ), name() );
2563 }
2564 }
2565
2566 //Monster will regen morale and aggression if it is on max HP
2567 //It regens more morale and aggression if is currently fleeing.
2568 if( type->regen_morale && hp >= type->hp ) {
2569 if( is_fleeing( g->u ) ) {
2570 morale = type->morale;
2571 anger = type->agro;
2572 }
2573 if( morale <= type->morale ) {
2574 morale += 1;
2575 }
2576 if( anger <= type->agro ) {
2577 anger += 1;
2578 }
2579 if( morale < 0 ) {
2580 morale += 5;
2581 }
2582 if( anger < 0 ) {
2583 anger += 5;
2584 }
2585 }
2586
2587 // If this critter dies in sunlight, check & assess damage.
2588 if( has_flag( MF_SUNDEATH ) && g->is_in_sunlight( pos() ) ) {
2589 if( g->u.sees( *this ) ) {
2590 add_msg( m_good, _( "The %s burns horribly in the sunlight!" ), name() );
2591 }
2592 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), 100 );
2593 if( hp < 0 ) {
2594 hp = 0;
2595 }
2596 }
2597}

2466 // Monsters don't get trait-based reduction, but they do get effect based reduction

2468 const auto get_effect = [&it, is_new]( const std::string & arg, bool reduced ) {
2469 if( is_new ) {
2470 return it.get_amount( arg, reduced );
2471 }
2472 return it.get_mod( arg, reduced );
2473 };
2474
2475 mod_speed_bonus( get_effect( "SPEED", reduced ) );
2476 mod_dodge_bonus( get_effect( "DODGE", reduced ) );
2477
2478 int val = get_effect( "HURT", reduced );

2480 if( is_new || it.activated( calendar::turn, "HURT", val, reduced, 1 ) ) {
2481 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), val );
2482 }
2483 }
2484

2486 // TODO: MATERIALS use fire resistance
2487 if( it.impairs_movement() ) {
2488 effect_cache[MOVEMENT_IMPAIRED] = true;
2489 } else if( id == effect_onfire ) {
2490 int dam = 0;
2491 if( made_of( material_id( "veggy" ) ) ) {
2492 dam = rng( 10, 20 );
2493 } else if( made_of( material_id( "flesh" ) ) || made_of( material_id( "iflesh" ) ) ) {
2494 dam = rng( 5, 10 );
2495 }
2496
2497 dam -= get_armor_type( DT_HEAT, bodypart_id( "torso" ) );
2498 if( dam > 0 ) {
2499 apply_damage( nullptr, bodypart_id( "torso" ), dam );
2500 } else {
2501 it.set_duration( 0_turns );
2502 }
2503 } else if( id == effect_run ) {
2504 effect_cache[FLEEING] = true;
2505 } else if( id == effect_no_sight || id == effect_blind ) {
2506 effect_cache[VISION_IMPAIRED] = true;
2507 }

◆ process_triggers()

void monster::process_triggers ( )

1193{
1194 process_trigger( mon_trigger::STALK, [this]() {
1195 return anger > 0 && one_in( 5 ) ? 1 : 0;
1196 } );
1197
1198 process_trigger( mon_trigger::FIRE, [this]() {
1199 int ret = 0;
1200 for( const auto &p : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 3 ) ) {
1201 ret += 5 * g->m.get_field_intensity( p, fd_fire );
1202 }
1203 return ret;
1204 } );
1205
1206 // Meat checking is disabled as for now.
1207 // It's hard to ever see it in action
1208 // and even harder to balance it without making it exploitable
1209
1210 if( morale != type->morale && one_in( 10 ) ) {
1211 if( morale < type->morale ) {
1212 morale++;
1213 } else {
1214 morale--;
1215 }
1216 }
1217
1218 if( anger != type->agro && one_in( 10 ) ) {
1219 if( anger < type->agro ) {
1220 anger++;
1221 } else {
1222 anger--;
1223 }
1224 }
1225
1226 // Cap values at [-100, 100] to prevent perma-angry moose etc.
1227 morale = std::min( 100, std::max( -100, morale ) );

2142 if( !calendar::once_every( e.second ) ) {

2158 // Special attack cooldowns are updated here.
2159 // Loop through the monster's special attacks, same as monster::move.
2160 for( const auto &sp_type : type->special_attacks ) {

2162 const auto local_iter = special_attacks.find( special_name );
2163 if( local_iter == special_attacks.end() ) {

2174 }
2175 // Persist grabs as long as there's an adjacent target.
2176 if( has_effect( effect_grabbing ) ) {
2177 for( auto &dest : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 1, 0 ) ) {
2178 const player *const p = g->critter_at<player>( dest );
2179 if( p && p->has_effect( effect_grabbed ) ) {
2180 add_effect( effect_grabbing, 2_turns );
2181 }
2182 }
2183 }
2184 // We update electrical fields here since they act every turn.
2185 if( has_flag( MF_ELECTRIC_FIELD ) ) {
2186 if( has_effect( effect_emp ) ) {
2187 if( calendar::once_every( 10_turns ) ) {
2188 sounds::sound( pos(), 5, sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "hummmmm." ), false, "humming", "electric" );
2189 }
2190 } else {
2191 for( const tripoint &zap : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 1 ) ) {
2192 const bool player_sees = g->u.sees( zap );
2193 const auto items = g->m.i_at( zap );
2194 for( const auto &item : items ) {
2195 if( item.made_of( LIQUID ) && item.flammable() ) { // start a fire!
2196 g->m.add_field( zap, fd_fire, 2, 1_minutes );
2197 sounds::sound( pos(), 30, sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "fwoosh!" ), false, "fire", "ignition" );
2198 break;
2199 }
2200 }
2201 if( zap != pos() ) {
2202 explosion_handler::emp_blast( zap ); // Fries electronics due to the intensity of the field
2203 }
2204 const auto t = g->m.ter( zap );
2205 if( t == ter_str_id( "t_gas_pump" ) || t == ter_str_id( "t_gas_pump_a" ) ) {
2206 if( one_in( 4 ) ) {
2207 explosion_handler::explosion( pos(), 40, 0.8, true );
2208 if( player_sees ) {
2209 add_msg( m_warning, _( "The %s explodes in a fiery inferno!" ), g->m.tername( zap ) );
2210 }
2211 } else {
2212 if( player_sees ) {
2213 add_msg( m_warning, _( "Lightning from %1$s engulfs the %2$s!" ), name(),
2214 g->m.tername( zap ) );
2215 }
2216 g->m.add_field( zap, fd_fire, 1, 2_turns );
2217 }
2218 }
2219 }
2220 if( get_weather().lightning_active && !has_effect( effect_supercharged ) &&
2221 g->m.is_outside( pos() ) ) {
2222 get_weather().lightning_active = false; // only one supercharge per strike
2223 sounds::sound( pos(), 300, sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "BOOOOOOOM!!!" ), false, "environment",
2224 "thunder_near" );
2225 sounds::sound( pos(), 20, sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "vrrrRRRUUMMMMMMMM!" ), false, "explosion",
2226 "default" );
2227 if( g->u.sees( pos() ) ) {
2228 add_msg( m_bad, _( "Lightning strikes the %s!" ), name() );
2229 add_msg( m_bad, _( "Your vision goes white!" ) );
2230 g->u.add_effect( effect_blind, rng( 1_minutes, 2_minutes ) );
2231 }
2232 add_effect( effect_supercharged, 12_hours );
2233 } else if( has_effect( effect_supercharged ) && calendar::once_every( 5_turns ) ) {
2234 sounds::sound( pos(), 20, sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "VMMMMMMMMM!" ), false, "humming",
2235 "electric" );
2236 }
2237 }
2238 }
2239

◆ push_to()

bool monster::push_to ( const tripoint &  p,
int  boost,
size_t  depth 
)

Try to push away whatever occupies p, then step in.

May recurse and try to make the creature at p push further.

Parameters
pLocation of pushed object
boostA bonus on the roll to represent a horde pushing from behind
depthNumber of recursions so far
Returns
True if we managed to push something and took its place, false otherwise.

Definition at line 1698 of file monmove.cpp.

1699{
1700 if( is_hallucination() ) {
1701 // Don't let hallucinations push, not even other hallucinations
1702 return false;
1703 }
1704
1705 if( !has_flag( MF_PUSH_MON ) || depth > 2 || has_effect( effect_pushed ) ) {
1706 return false;
1707 }
1708
1709 // TODO: Generalize this to Creature
1710 monster *const critter = g->critter_at<monster>( p );
1711 if( critter == nullptr || critter == this ||
1712 p == pos() || critter->movement_impaired() ) {
1713 return false;
1714 }
1715
1716 if( !can_move_to( p ) ) {
1717 return false;
1718 }
1719
1720 if( critter->is_hallucination() ) {
1721 // Kill the hallu, but return false so that the regular move_to is uses instead
1722 critter->die( nullptr );
1723 return false;
1724 }
1725
1726 // Stability roll of the pushed critter
1727 const int defend = critter->stability_roll();
1728 // Stability roll of the pushing zed
1729 const int attack = stability_roll() + boost;
1730 if( defend > attack ) {
1731 return false;
1732 }
1733
1734 const int movecost_from = 50 * g->m.move_cost( p );
1735 const int movecost_attacker = std::max( movecost_from, 200 - 10 * ( attack - defend ) );
1736 const tripoint dir = p - pos();
1737
1738 // Mark self as pushed to simplify recursive pushing
1739 add_effect( effect_pushed, 1_turns );
1740
1741 for( size_t i = 0; i < 6; i++ ) {
1742 const point d{ rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ) };
1743 if( d.x == 0 && d.y == 0 ) {
1744 continue;
1745 }
1746
1747 // Pushing forward is easier than pushing aside
1748 const int direction_penalty = std::abs( d.x - dir.x ) + std::abs( d.y - dir.y );
1749 if( direction_penalty > 2 ) {
1750 continue;
1751 }
1752
1753 tripoint dest( p + d );
1754 const int dest_movecost_from = 50 * g->m.move_cost( dest );
1755
1756 // Pushing into cars/windows etc. is harder
1757 const int movecost_penalty = g->m.move_cost( dest ) - 2;
1758 if( movecost_penalty <= -2 ) {
1759 // Can't push into unpassable terrain
1760 continue;
1761 }
1762
1763 int roll = attack - ( defend + direction_penalty + movecost_penalty );
1764 if( roll < 0 ) {
1765 continue;
1766 }
1767
1768 Creature *critter_recur = g->critter_at( dest );
1769 if( !( critter_recur == nullptr || critter_recur->is_hallucination() ) ) {
1770 // Try to push recursively
1771 monster *mon_recur = dynamic_cast< monster * >( critter_recur );
1772 if( mon_recur == nullptr ) {
1773 continue;
1774 }
1775
1776 if( critter->push_to( dest, roll, depth + 1 ) ) {
1777 // The tile isn't necessarily free, need to check
1778 if( !g->critter_at( p ) ) {
1779 move_to( p );
1780 }
1781
1782 moves -= movecost_attacker;
1783
1784 // Don't knock down a creature that successfully
1785 // pushed another creature, just reduce moves
1786 critter->moves -= dest_movecost_from;
1787 return true;
1788 } else {
1789 return false;
1790 }
1791 }
1792
1793 critter_recur = g->critter_at( dest );
1794 if( critter_recur != nullptr ) {
1795 if( critter_recur->is_hallucination() ) {
1796 critter_recur->die( nullptr );
1797 }
1798 } else if( !critter->has_flag( MF_IMMOBILE ) ) {
1799 critter->setpos( dest );
1800 move_to( p );
1801 moves -= movecost_attacker;
1802 critter->add_effect( effect_downed, time_duration::from_turns( movecost_from / 100 + 1 ) );
1803 }
1804 return true;
1805 }
1806
1807 // Try to trample over a much weaker zed (or one with worse rolls)
1808 // Don't allow trampling with boost
1809 if( boost > 0 || attack < 2 * defend ) {
1810 return false;
1811 }
1812
1813 g->swap_critters( *critter, *this );
1814 critter->add_effect( effect_stunned, rng( 0_turns, 2_turns ) );
1815 // Only print the message when near player or it can get spammy
1816 if( rl_dist( g->u.pos(), pos() ) < 4 && g->u.sees( *critter ) ) {
1817 add_msg( m_warning, _( "The %1$s tramples %2$s" ),
1818 name(), critter->disp_name() );
1819 }
1820
1821 moves -= movecost_attacker;
1822 if( movecost_from > 100 ) {
1823 critter->add_effect( effect_downed, time_duration::from_turns( movecost_from / 100 + 1 ) );
1824 } else {
1825 critter->moves -= movecost_from;
1826 }
1827
1828 return true;
1829}

◆ rate_target()

float monster::rate_target ( Creature &  c,
float  best,
bool  smart = false 
) const

Definition at line 273 of file monmove.cpp.

274{
275 const auto d = rl_dist_fast( pos(), c.pos() );
276 if( d <= 0 ) {
277 return FLT_MAX;
278 }
279
280 // Check a very common and cheap case first
281 if( !smart && d >= best ) {
282 return FLT_MAX;
283 }
284
285 if( !sees( c ) ) {
286 return FLT_MAX;
287 }
288
289 if( !smart ) {
290 return int( d );
291 }
292
293 float power = c.power_rating();
294 monster *mon = dynamic_cast< monster * >( &c );
295 // Their attitude to us and not ours to them, so that bobcats won't get gunned down
296 if( mon != nullptr && mon->attitude_to( *this ) == Attitude::A_HOSTILE ) {
297 power += 2;
298 }
299
300 if( power > 0 ) {
301 return int( d ) / power;
302 }
303
304 return FLT_MAX;
305}

◆ refill_udders()

void monster::refill_udders ( )

Definition at line 449 of file monster.cpp.

450{
451 if( type->starting_ammo.empty() ) {
452 debugmsg( "monster %s has no starting ammo to refill udders", get_name() );
453 return;
454 }
455 if( ammo.empty() ) {
456 // legacy animals got empty ammo map, fill them up now if needed.
457 ammo[type->starting_ammo.begin()->first] = type->starting_ammo.begin()->second;
458 }
459 auto current_milk = ammo.find( itype_milk_raw );
460 if( current_milk == ammo.end() ) {
461 current_milk = ammo.find( itype_milk );
462 if( current_milk != ammo.end() ) {
463 // take this opportunity to update milk udders to raw_milk
464 ammo[itype_milk_raw] = current_milk->second;
465 // Erase old key-value from map
466 ammo.erase( current_milk );
467 }
468 }
469 // if we got here, we got milk.
470 if( current_milk->second == type->starting_ammo.begin()->second ) {
471 // already full up
472 return;
473 }
474 if( calendar::turn - udder_timer > 1_days ) {
475 // no point granularizing this really, you milk once a day.
476 ammo.begin()->second = type->starting_ammo.begin()->second;
477 udder_timer = calendar::turn;
478 }
479}

◆ scent_move()

tripoint monster::scent_move ( )

Definition at line 1154 of file monmove.cpp.

1155{
1156 // TODO: Remove when scentmap is 3D
1157 if( std::abs( posz() - g->get_levz() ) > SCENT_MAP_Z_REACH ) {
1158 return { -1, -1, INT_MIN };
1159 }
1160
1161 const std::set<scenttype_id> &tracked_scents = type->scents_tracked;
1162 const std::set<scenttype_id> &ignored_scents = type->scents_ignored;
1163
1164 std::vector<tripoint> smoves;
1165
1166 int bestsmell = 10; // Squares with smell 0 are not eligible targets.
1167 int smell_threshold = 200; // Squares at or above this level are ineligible.
1168 if( has_flag( MF_KEENNOSE ) ) {
1169 bestsmell = 1;
1170 smell_threshold = 400;
1171 }
1172
1173 const bool fleeing = is_fleeing( g->u );
1174 if( fleeing ) {
1175 bestsmell = g->scent.get( pos() );
1176 }
1177
1178 tripoint next( -1, -1, posz() );
1179 if( ( !fleeing && g->scent.get( pos() ) > smell_threshold ) ||
1180 ( fleeing && bestsmell == 0 ) ) {
1181 return next;
1182 }
1183 const bool can_bash = bash_skill() > 0;
1184 for( const auto &dest : g->m.points_in_radius( pos(), 1, SCENT_MAP_Z_REACH ) ) {
1185 int smell = g->scent.get( dest );
1186 const scenttype_id &type_scent = g->scent.get_type( dest );
1187
1188 bool right_scent = false;
1189 // is the monster tracking this scent
1190 if( !tracked_scents.empty() ) {
1191 right_scent = tracked_scents.find( type_scent ) != tracked_scents.end();
1192 }
1193 //is this scent recognised by the monster species
1194 if( !type_scent.is_empty() ) {
1195 const std::set<species_id> &receptive_species = type_scent->receptive_species;
1196 const std::set<species_id> &monster_species = type->species;
1197 std::vector<species_id> v_intersection;
1198 std::set_intersection( receptive_species.begin(), receptive_species.end(), monster_species.begin(),
1199 monster_species.end(), std::back_inserter( v_intersection ) );
1200 if( !v_intersection.empty() ) {
1201 right_scent = true;
1202 }
1203 }
1204 // is the monster actually ignoring this scent
1205 if( !ignored_scents.empty() && ( ignored_scents.find( type_scent ) != ignored_scents.end() ) ) {
1206 right_scent = false;
1207 }
1208
1209 if( ( !fleeing && smell < bestsmell ) || ( fleeing && smell > bestsmell ) || !right_scent ) {
1210 continue;
1211 }
1212 if( g->m.valid_move( pos(), dest, can_bash, true ) &&
1213 ( can_move_to( dest ) || ( dest == g->u.pos() ) ||
1214 ( can_bash && g->m.bash_rating( bash_estimate(), dest ) > 0 ) ) ) {
1215 if( ( !fleeing && smell > bestsmell ) || ( fleeing && smell < bestsmell ) ) {
1216 smoves.clear();
1217 smoves.push_back( dest );
1218 bestsmell = smell;
1219 } else if( ( !fleeing && smell == bestsmell ) || ( fleeing && smell == bestsmell ) ) {
1220 smoves.push_back( dest );
1221 }
1222 }
1223 }
1224
1225 return random_entry( smoves, next );
1226}

2036 case MS_SMALL:
2037 break;
2038 case MS_MEDIUM:

2041 shove_veh_mass_moves_factor = 20;
2042 shove_velocity = 500;

2050 shove_veh_mass_moves_factor = 8;
2051 shove_velocity = 1000;
2052 shove_damage_min = 0.00F;
2053 shove_damage_max = 0.03F;
2054 }
2055 break;
2056 case MS_HUGE:
2057 if( veh_mass < 2000_kilogram ) {
2058 shove_moves_minimal = 50;
2059 shove_veh_mass_moves_factor = 4;
2060 shove_velocity = 1500;
2061 shove_damage_min = 0.00F;
2062 shove_damage_max = 0.05F;
2063 }
2064 break;
2065 default:
2066 break;
2067 }
2068 if( shove_velocity > 0 ) {
2069 if( g->u.sees( this->pos() ) ) {
2070 //~ %1$s - monster name, %2$s - vehicle name
2071 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "%1$s shoves %2$s out of their way!" ), this->disp_name(),
2072 veh.disp_name() );
2073 }
2074 int shove_moves = shove_veh_mass_moves_factor * veh_mass / 10_kilogram;
2075 shove_moves = std::max( shove_moves, shove_moves_minimal );
2076 this->mod_moves( -shove_moves );
2077 const tripoint destination_delta( -nearby_destination + remote_destination );
2078 const tripoint shove_destination( clamp( destination_delta.x, -1, 1 ),
2079 clamp( destination_delta.y, -1, 1 ),
2080 clamp( destination_delta.z, -1, 1 ) );
2081 veh.skidding = true;
2082 veh.velocity = shove_velocity;
2083 if( shove_destination != tripoint_zero ) {
2084 if( shove_destination.z != 0 ) {
2085 veh.vertical_velocity = shove_destination.z < 0 ? -shove_velocity : +shove_velocity;
2086 }
2087 g->m.move_vehicle( veh, shove_destination, veh.face );
2088 }
2089 veh.move = tileray( destination_delta.xy() );
2090 veh.smash( g->m, shove_damage_min, shove_damage_max, 0.10F );
2091 }
2092 }
2093 }

◆ stumble()

void monster::stumble ( )

Stumble in a random direction, but with some caveats.

Definition at line 1834 of file monmove.cpp.

1835{
1836 // Only move every 10 turns.
1837 if( !one_in( 10 ) ) {
1838 return;
1839 }
1840
1841 map &here = get_map();
1842
1843 std::vector<tripoint> valid_stumbles;
1844 valid_stumbles.reserve( 11 );
1845 const bool avoid_water = has_flag( MF_NO_BREATHE ) && !swims() && !has_flag( MF_AQUATIC );
1846 for( const tripoint &dest : here.points_in_radius( pos(), 1 ) ) {
1847 if( dest != pos() ) {
1848 if( here.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, dest ) ) {
1849 valid_stumbles.push_back( tripoint( dest.xy(), dest.z - 1 ) );
1850 } else if( here.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_UP, dest ) ) {
1851 valid_stumbles.push_back( tripoint( dest.xy(), dest.z + 1 ) );
1852 } else {
1853 valid_stumbles.push_back( dest );
1854 }
1855 }
1856 }
1857
1858 if( here.has_zlevels() ) {
1859 tripoint below( posx(), posy(), posz() - 1 );
1860 if( here.valid_move( pos(), below, false, true ) ) {
1861 valid_stumbles.push_back( below );
1862 }
1863 }
1864 while( !valid_stumbles.empty() && !is_dead() ) {
1865 const tripoint dest = random_entry_removed( valid_stumbles );
1866 if( can_move_to( dest ) &&
1867 //Stop zombies and other non-breathing monsters wandering INTO water
1868 //(Unless they can swim/are aquatic)
1869 //But let them wander OUT of water if they are there.
1870 !( avoid_water &&
1871 here.has_flag( TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, dest ) &&
1872 !here.has_flag( TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, pos() ) ) &&
1873 ( g->critter_at( dest, is_hallucination() ) == nullptr ) ) {
1874 if( move_to( dest, true, false ) ) {
1875 break;
1876 }
1877 }
1878 }
1879}

◆ try_reproduce()

void monster::try_reproduce ( )

Definition at line 390 of file monster.cpp.

391{
392 if( !reproduces ) {
393 return;
394 }
395 // This can happen if the monster type has changed (from reproducing to non-reproducing monster)
396 if( !type->baby_timer ) {
397 return;
398 }
399
400 if( !baby_timer ) {
401 // Assume this is a freshly spawned monster (because baby_timer is not set yet), set the point when it reproduce to somewhere in the future.
402 baby_timer.emplace( calendar::turn + *type->baby_timer );
403 }
404
405 bool season_spawn = false;
406 bool season_match = true;
407
408 // only 50% of animals should reproduce
409 bool female = one_in( 2 );
410 for( auto &elem : type->baby_flags ) {
411 if( elem == "SUMMER" || elem == "WINTER" || elem == "SPRING" || elem == "AUTUMN" ) {
412 season_spawn = true;
413 }
414 }
415
416 // add a decreasing chance of additional spawns when "catching up" an existing animal
417 int chance = -1;
418 while( true ) {
419 if( *baby_timer > calendar::turn ) {
420 return;
421 }
422
423 if( season_spawn ) {
424 season_match = false;
425 for( auto &elem : type->baby_flags ) {
426 if( ( season_of_year( *baby_timer ) == SUMMER && elem == "SUMMER" ) ||
427 ( season_of_year( *baby_timer ) == WINTER && elem == "WINTER" ) ||
428 ( season_of_year( *baby_timer ) == SPRING && elem == "SPRING" ) ||
429 ( season_of_year( *baby_timer ) == AUTUMN && elem == "AUTUMN" ) ) {
430 season_match = true;
431 }
432 }
433 }
434
435 chance += 2;
436 if( season_match && female && one_in( chance ) ) {
437 int spawn_cnt = rng( 1, type->baby_count );
438 if( type->baby_monster ) {
439 g->m.add_spawn( type->baby_monster, spawn_cnt, pos() );
440 } else {
441 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos(), item( type->baby_egg, *baby_timer, spawn_cnt ), true );
442 }
443 }
444
445 *baby_timer += *type->baby_timer;
446 }
447}
mtype::baby_count
int baby_count
Definition: mtype.h:334
mtype::baby_egg
itype_id baby_egg
Definition: mtype.h:336

Referenced by on_load().

◆ try_upgrade()

void monster::try_upgrade ( bool  pin_time)

Definition at line 331 of file monster.cpp.

332{
333 if( !can_upgrade() ) {
334 return;
335 }
336
337 const int current_day = to_days<int>( calendar::turn - calendar::turn_zero );
338 //This should only occur when a monster is created or upgraded to a new form
339 if( upgrade_time < 0 ) {
340 upgrade_time = next_upgrade_time();
341 if( upgrade_time < 0 ) {
342 return;
343 }
344 if( pin_time || type->age_grow > 0 ) {
345 // offset by today, always true for growing creatures
346 upgrade_time += current_day;
347 } else {
348 // offset by starting season
349 // TODO: revisit this and make it simpler
350 upgrade_time += to_days<int>( calendar::start_of_cataclysm - calendar::turn_zero );
351 }
352 }
353
354 // Here we iterate until we either are before upgrade_time or can't upgrade any more.
355 // This is so that late into game new monsters can 'catch up' with all that half-life
356 // upgrades they'd get if we were simulating whole world.
357 while( true ) {
358 if( upgrade_time > current_day ) {
359 // not yet
360 return;
361 }
362
363 if( type->upgrade_into ) {
364 //If we upgrade into a blacklisted monster, treat it as though we are non-upgradeable
365 if( MonsterGroupManager::monster_is_blacklisted( type->upgrade_into ) ) {
366 return;
367 }
368 poly( type->upgrade_into );
369 } else {
370 const mtype_id &new_type = MonsterGroupManager::GetRandomMonsterFromGroup( type->upgrade_group );
371 if( new_type ) {
372 poly( new_type );
373 }
374 }
375
376 if( !upgrades ) {
377 // upgraded into a non-upgradeable monster
378 return;
379 }
380
381 const int next_upgrade = next_upgrade_time();
382 if( next_upgrade < 0 ) {
383 // hit never_upgrade
384 return;
385 }
386 upgrade_time += next_upgrade;
387 }
388}
MonsterGroupManager::monster_is_blacklisted
static bool monster_is_blacklisted(const mtype_id &m)
Definition: mongroup.cpp:280
MonsterGroupManager::GetRandomMonsterFromGroup
static const mtype_id & GetRandomMonsterFromGroup(const mongroup_id &group)
Gets a random monster, weighted by frequency.
Definition: mongroup.cpp:434

int next_upgrade_time()
Normal upgrades.

◆ turns_to_reach()

Definition at line 1996 of file monmove.cpp.

1997{
1998 // HACK: This function is a(n old) temporary hack that should soon be removed
1999 auto path = g->m.route( pos(), tripoint( p, posz() ), get_pathfinding_settings() );
2000 if( path.empty() ) {
2001 return 999;
2002 }
2003
2004 double turns = 0.;
2005 for( size_t i = 0; i < path.size(); i++ ) {
2006 const tripoint &next = path[i];
2007 if( g->m.impassable( next ) ) {
2008 // No bashing through, it looks stupid when you go back and find
2009 // the doors intact.
2010 return 999;
2011 } else if( i == 0 ) {
2012 turns += static_cast<double>( calc_movecost( pos(), next ) ) / get_speed();
2013 } else {
2014 turns += static_cast<double>( calc_movecost( path[i - 1], next ) ) / get_speed();
2015 }
2016 }
2017
2018 return static_cast<int>( turns + .9 ); // Halve (to get turns) and round up
2019}

References calc_movecost(), g, get_pathfinding_settings(), Creature::get_speed(), path, pos(), and posz().

◆ wander_to()

void monster::wander_to ( const tripoint &  p,
int  f 
)

Set p as wander destination.

This will cause the monster to slowly move towards the destination, unless there is an overriding smell or plan.

Parameters
pDestination of monster's wanderings
fThe priority of the destination, as well as how long we should wander towards there.

◆ will_move_to()

bool monster::will_move_to ( const tripoint &  p) const

Definition at line 117 of file monmove.cpp.

118{
119 if( g->m.impassable( p ) ) {
120 if( digging() ) {
121 if( !g->m.has_flag( "BURROWABLE", p ) ) {
122 return false;
123 }
124 } else if( !( can_climb() && g->m.has_flag( "CLIMBABLE", p ) ) ) {
125 return false;
126 }
127 }
128
129 if( ( !can_submerge() && !flies() ) && g->m.has_flag( TFLAG_DEEP_WATER, p ) ) {
130 return false;
131 }
132
133 if( digs() && !g->m.has_flag( "DIGGABLE", p ) && !g->m.has_flag( "BURROWABLE", p ) ) {
134 return false;
135 }
136
137 if( has_flag( MF_AQUATIC ) && !g->m.has_flag( "SWIMMABLE", p ) ) {
138 return false;
139 }
140
141 if( has_flag( MF_SUNDEATH ) && g->is_in_sunlight( p ) ) {
142 return false;
143 }
144
145 if( get_size() > MS_MEDIUM && g->m.has_flag_ter( TFLAG_SMALL_PASSAGE, p ) ) {
146 return false; // if a large critter, can't move through tight passages
147 }
148
149 // Various avoiding behaviors.
150
151 bool avoid_fire = has_flag( MF_AVOID_FIRE );
152 bool avoid_fall = has_flag( MF_AVOID_FALL );
153 bool avoid_simple = has_flag( MF_AVOID_DANGER_1 );
154 bool avoid_complex = has_flag( MF_AVOID_DANGER_2 );
155 /*
156 * Because some avoidance behaviors are supersets of others,
157 * we can cascade through the implications. Complex implies simple,
158 * and simple implies fire and fall.
159 * unfortunately, fall does not necessarily imply fire, nor the converse.
160 */
161 if( avoid_complex ) {
162 avoid_simple = true;
163 }
164 if( avoid_simple ) {
165 avoid_fire = true;
166 avoid_fall = true;
167 }
168
169 // technically this will shortcut in evaluation from fire or fall
170 // before hitting simple or complex but this is more explicit
171 if( avoid_fire || avoid_fall || avoid_simple || avoid_complex ) {
172 const ter_id target = g->m.ter( p );
173
174 // Don't enter lava if we have any concept of heat being bad
175 if( avoid_fire && target == t_lava ) {
176 return false;
177 }
178
179 if( avoid_fall ) {
180 // Don't throw ourselves off cliffs if we have a concept of falling
181 if( !g->m.has_floor( p ) && !flies() ) {
182 return false;
183 }
184
185 // Don't enter open pits ever unless tiny, can fly or climb well
186 if( !( type->size == MS_TINY || can_climb() ) &&
187 ( target == t_pit || target == t_pit_spiked || target == t_pit_glass ) ) {
188 return false;
189 }
190 }
191
192 // Some things are only avoided if we're not attacking
193 if( attitude( &g->u ) != MATT_ATTACK ) {
194 // Sharp terrain is ignored while attacking
195 if( avoid_simple && g->m.has_flag( "SHARP", p ) &&
196 !( type->size == MS_TINY || flies() ) ) {
197 return false;
198 }
199 }
200
201 const field &target_field = g->m.field_at( p );
202
203 // Higher awareness is needed for identifying these as threats.
204 if( avoid_complex ) {
205 const trap &target_trap = g->m.tr_at( p );
206 // Don't enter any dangerous fields
207 if( is_dangerous_fields( target_field ) ) {
208 return false;
209 }
210 // Don't step on any traps (if we can see)
211 if( has_flag( MF_SEES ) && !target_trap.is_benign() && g->m.has_floor( p ) ) {
212 return false;
213 }
214 }
215
216 // Without avoid_complex, only fire and electricity are checked for field avoidance.
217 if( avoid_fire && target_field.find_field( fd_fire ) ) {
218 return false;
219 }
220 if( avoid_simple && target_field.find_field( fd_electricity ) ) {
221 return false;
222 }
223 }
224
225 return true;
226}
Creature::is_dangerous_fields
bool is_dangerous_fields(const field &fld) const
Returns true if there is a field in the field set that is dangerous to us.

bool is_benign() const
If true, this is not really a trap and there won't be any safety queries before stepping onto it (e....

1960{
1961 monster_attitude att = attitude( &g->u );

1975 if( path.empty() ) {
1976 return false;
1977 }

1986 return true;

1990 return true;
1991 }

1994}
